column1: 31186339;The Hunger Games;"The nation of Panem consists of a wealthy Capitol and twelve poorer districts. As punishment for a past rebellion
column2: each district must provide a boy and girl  between the ages of 12 and 18 selected by lottery  for the annual Hunger Games. The tributes must fight to the death in an arena; the sole survivor is rewarded with fame and wealth. In her first Reaping
column3: 12-year-old Primrose Everdeen is chosen from District 12. Her older sister Katniss volunteers to take her place. Peeta Mellark
column4: a baker's son who once gave Katniss bread when she was starving
column5: is the other District 12 tribute. Katniss and Peeta are taken to the Capitol
column6: accompanied by their frequently drunk mentor
column7: past victor Haymitch Abernathy. He warns them about the ""Career"" tributes who train intensively at special academies and almost always win. During a TV interview with Caesar Flickerman
column8: Peeta unexpectedly reveals his love for Katniss. She is outraged
column9: believing it to be a ploy to gain audience support
column10: as ""sponsors"" may provide in-Games gifts of food
column11: medicine
column12: and tools. However
column13: she discovers Peeta meant what he said. The televised Games begin with half of the tributes killed in the first few minutes; Katniss barely survives ignoring Haymitch's advice to run away from the melee over the tempting supplies and weapons strewn in front of a structure called the Cornucopia. Peeta forms an uneasy alliance with the four Careers. They later find Katniss and corner her up a tree. Rue
column14: hiding in a nearby tree
column15: draws her attention to a poisonous tracker jacker nest hanging from a branch. Katniss drops it on her sleeping besiegers. They all scatter
column16: except for Glimmer
column17: who is killed by the insects. Hallucinating due to tracker jacker venom
column18: Katniss is warned to run away by Peeta. Rue cares for Katniss for a couple of days until she recovers. Meanwhile
column19: the alliance has gathered all the supplies into a pile. Katniss has Rue draw them off
column20: then destroys the stockpile by setting off the mines planted around it. Furious
column21: Cato kills the boy assigned to guard it. As Katniss runs from the scene
column22: she hears Rue calling her name. She finds Rue trapped and releases her. Marvel
column23: a tribute from District 1
column24: throws a spear at Katniss
column25: but she dodges the spear
column26: causing it to stab Rue in the stomach instead. Katniss shoots him dead with an arrow. She then comforts the dying Rue with a song. Afterward
column27: she gathers and arranges flowers around Rue's body. When this is televised
column28: it sparks a riot in Rue's District 11. President Snow summons Seneca Crane
column29: the Gamemaker
column30: to express his displeasure at the way the Games are turning out. Since Katniss and Peeta have been presented to the public as ""star-crossed lovers""
column31: Haymitch is able to convince Crane to make a rule change to avoid inciting further riots. It is announced that tributes from the same district can win as a pair. Upon hearing this
column32: Katniss searches for Peeta and finds him with an infected sword wound in the leg. She portrays herself as deeply in love with him and gains a sponsor's gift of soup. An announcer proclaims a feast
column33: where the thing each survivor needs most will be provided. Peeta begs her not to risk getting him medicine. Katniss promises not to go
column34: but after he falls asleep
column35: she heads to the feast. Clove ambushes her and pins her down. As Clove gloats
column36: Thresh
column37: the other District 11 tribute
column38: kills Clove after overhearing her tormenting Katniss about killing Rue. He spares Katniss ""just this time...for Rue"". The medicine works
column39: keeping Peeta mobile. Foxface
column40: the girl from District 5
column41: dies from eating nightlock berries she stole from Peeta; neither knew they are highly poisonous. Crane changes the time of day in the arena to late at night and unleashes a pack of hound-like creatures to speed things up. They kill Thresh and force Katniss and Peeta to flee to the roof of the Cornucopia
column42: where they encounter Cato. After a battle
column43: Katniss wounds Cato with an arrow and Peeta hurls him to the creatures below. Katniss shoots Cato to spare him a prolonged death. With Peeta and Katniss apparently victorious
column44: the rule change allowing two winners is suddenly revoked. Peeta tells Katniss to shoot him. Instead
column45: she gives him half of the nightlock. However
column46: before they can commit suicide
column47: they are hastily proclaimed the victors of the 74th Hunger Games. Haymitch warns Katniss that she has made powerful enemies after her display of defiance. She and Peeta return to District 12
column48: while Crane is locked in a room with a bowl of nightlock berries
column49: and President Snow considers the situation."

column1: 20663735;Narasimham;Poovalli Induchoodan  is sentenced for six years prison life for murdering his classmate. Induchoodan
column2: the only son of Justice Maranchery Karunakara Menon  was framed in the case by Manapally Madhavan Nambiar  and his crony DYSP Sankaranarayanan  to take revenge on idealist judge Menon who had earlier given jail sentence to Manapally in a corruption case. Induchoodan
column3: who had achieved top rank in Indian Civil Service loses the post and Manapally Sudheeran ([[Saikumar  enters the list of civil service trainees. We learn in flashback that it was Ramakrishnan  the son of Moopil Nair
column4: who had actually killed his classmate. Six years passes by and Manapally Madhavan Nambiar
column5: now a former state minister
column6: is dead and Induchoodan
column7: who is all rage at the gross injustice meted out to him - thus destroying his promising life
column8: is released from prison. Induchoodan thwarts Manapally Pavithran  from performing the funeral rituals of Nambiar at Bharathapuzha. Many confrontations between Induchoodan and Manapally's henchmen follow. Induchoodan also falls in love with Anuradha ([[Aishwarya
column9: the strong-willed and independent-minded daughter of Mooppil Nair. Justice Menon and his wife returns back to Kerala to stay with Induchoodan. There is an appearance of a girl named Indulekha ([[Kanaka
column10: who claims to be the daughter of Justice Menon. Menon flatly refuses the claim and banishes her. Forced by circumstances and at the instigation and help of Manapally Pavithran
column11: she reluctantly come out open with the claim. Induchoodan at first thrashes the protesters. But upon knowing the truth from Chandrabhanu his uncle
column12: he accepts the task of her protection in the capacity as elder brother. Induchoodan decides to marry off Indulekha to his good friend Jayakrishnan . Induchoodan has a confrontation with his father and prods him to accept mistake and acknowledge the parentage of Indulekha. Menon ultimately regrets and goes on to confess to his daughter. The very next day
column13: when Induchoodan returns to Poovally
column14: Indulekha is found dead and Menon is accused of murdering her. The whole act was planned by Pavithran
column15: who after killing Indulekha
column16: forces Raman Nair  to testify against Menon in court. In court
column17: Nandagopal Maarar
column18: a close friend of Induchoodan and a famous supreme court lawyer
column19: appears for Menon and manages to lay bare the murder plot and hidden intentions of other party . Menon is judged innocent of the crime by court. After confronting Pavithran and promising just retribution to the crime of killing Indulekha
column20: Induchoodan returns to his father
column21: who now shows remorse for all his actions including not believing in the innocence of his son. But while speaking to Induchoodan
column22: Menon suffers a heart stroke and passes away. At Menon's funeral
column23: Manapally Pavithran arrives to poke fun at Induchoodan and he also tries to carry out the postponed last rituals of his own father. Induchoodan interrupts the ritual and avenges for the death of his sister and father by severely injuring Pavithran. On his way back to peaceful life
column24: Induchoodan accepts Anuradha as his life partner.

column1: 2231378;The Lemon Drop Kid;"The Lemon Drop Kid
column2: a New York City swindler
column3: is illegally touting horses at a Florida racetrack. After several successful hustles
column4: the Kid comes across a beautiful
column5: but gullible
column6: woman intending to bet a lot of money. The Kid convinces her to switch her bet
column7: employing a prefabricated con. Unfortunately for the Kid
column8: the woman ""belongs"" to notorious gangster Moose Moran
column9: as does the money. The Kid's choice finishes dead last and a furious Moran demands the Kid provide him with $10
column10: 000  by Christmas Eve
column11: or the Kid ""won't make it to New Year's."" The Kid decides to return to New York to try to come up with the money. He first tries his on-again
column12: off-again girlfriend Brainy Baxter . However
column13: when talk of long-term commitment arises
column14: the Kid quickly makes an escape. He next visits local crime boss ""Oxford"" Charley
column15: with whom he has had past dealings. This falls through as Charley is in serious tax trouble and does not particularly care for the Kid anyway. As he leaves Charley's establishment and is about to give up hope
column16: the Kid notices a cornerside Santa Claus and his kettle. Thinking quickly
column17: the Kid fashions himself a Santa suit and begins collecting donations. This fails as he is recognized by a passing policeman
column18: who remembers his previous underhanded activity well. The Kid lands in court
column19: where he is convicted of collecting for a charity without a license and sentenced to ten days in jail . However
column20: while in court
column21: the Kid learns where his scheme went wrong. After a short stay
column22: Brainy arrives to bail him out. He then sets about restarting his Santa operation
column23: this time with legitimate backing. To this end
column24: he needs a charity to represent and a city license. The kid receives key inspiration when he remembers that Nellie Thursday
column25: a kindly neighborhood resident
column26: has been denied entry to a retirement home because of her jailed husband's criminal past as a safecracker. Organizing other small-time New York swindlers and Brainy
column27: who is both surprised and charmed at the Kid's apparent goodwill
column28: the Kid converts an abandoned casino  into the ""Nellie Thursday Home For Old Dolls"". A small group of elderly women and makeshift amenities complete the project. The Kid is able to receive the all-important city license. Now free to collect
column29: the Kid and his compatriots dress as Santa Claus and position themselves throughout Manhattan. The others are unaware that the Kid plans to keep the money for himself to pay off Moran. The scheme is a huge success
column30: netting $2
column31: 000 in only a few days. An overjoyed Brainy decides to leave her job as a dancer and look after the ""home"" full-time until after Christmas. Coincidentally
column32: her employer is none other than ""Oxford"" Charley
column33: whom Brainy cheerfully informs of the effort. Seeing a potential gold mine
column34: Charley decides to muscle in on the operation. Reasoning that the Nellie Thursday home is ""wherever Nellie Thursday is""
column35: Charley and his crew kidnap the home's inhabitants  and move them to Charley's mansion in Nyack. The Kid learns of this when he returns to the home after a late night to find the home deserted and money  gone. Clued in by oversized Oxford footprints in the snow
column36: the Kid and his friends pay Charley a visit. Here
column37: Charley reveals the true nature of the Kid's scheme through a phone conversation with Moose Moran. The Kid's accomplices are angry and move to confront him
column38: but the Kid manages to slip away. However
column39: Brainy tracks him down outside and voices her disgust at his actions. After a few days of stewing in self-pity
column40: the Kid is surprised to meet Nellie
column41: who has escaped Charley's compound. He decides to recover the money
column42: sneaking into Charley's home in the guise of an elderly woman. He finds that Charley and his crew are again moving the women
column43: this time to a more secure location. Using the heightened activity to his advantage
column44: the Kid enters Charley's office and confronts him. After a brief struggle
column45: the Kid overpowers Charley and makes off with the money
column46: narrowly avoiding the thugs Charley has sent after him. The ensuing chaos allows Brainy and the others to escape. Later that night
column47: the Kid returns to the original Nellie Thursday home to meet with Moose Moran . The deal appears to be in jeopardy as Moran arrives with Charley. Charley demands that the Kid reimburse him
column48: which would leave too little for Moran. However
column49: the Kid turns the tables by hitting a switch
column50: revealing hidden casino tables. All are occupied
column51: mainly by the escaped old dolls. The Kid and his still-loyal friends hold off the gangsters as the police initiate a raid. Moran and Charley are arrested while the judge who sentenced the Kid earlier warns that he will be ""keeping an eye on him"". The Kid assures him that will not be necessary and his attention will lie on the home
column52: which is going to become a reality. The night's main event begins as Nellie's husband Henry
column53: free on parole
column54: joyously reunites with his wife."

column1: 595909;A Cry in the Dark;"Seventh-day Adventist Church pastor Michael Chamberlain
column2: his wife Lindy
column3: their two sons
column4: and their nine-week-old daughter Azaria are on a camping holiday in the Outback. With the baby sleeping in their tent
column5: the family is enjoying a barbecue with their fellow campers when a cry is heard. Lindy returns to the tent to check on Azaria and is certain she sees a dingo with something in its mouth running off as she approaches. When she discovers the infant is missing
column6: everyone joins forces to search for her
column7: without success. It is assumed what Lindy saw was the animal carrying off the child
column8: and a subsequent inquest rules her account of events is true. The tide of public opinion soon turns against the Chamberlains. For many
column9: Lindy seems too stoic
column10: too cold-hearted
column11: and too accepting of the disaster that has befallen her. Gossip about her begins to swell and soon is accepted as statements of fact. The couple's beliefs are not widely practised in the country
column12: and when the media report a rumour that the name Azaria means ""sacrifice in the wilderness""
column13: the public is quick to believe they decapitated their baby with a pair of scissors as part of a bizarre religious rite. Law-enforcement officials find new witnesses
column14: forensics experts
column15: and a lot of circumstantial evidence—including a small wooden coffin Michael uses as a receptacle for his parishioners' packs of un-smoked cigarettes—and reopen the investigation
column16: and eventually Lindy is charged with murder. Seven months pregnant
column17: she ignores her attorneys' advice to play on the jury's sympathy and appears emotionless on the stand
column18: convincing onlookers she is guilty of the crime of which she is accused. As the trial progresses
column19: Michael's faith in his religion and his belief in his wife disintegrate
column20: and he stumbles through his testimony
column21: suggesting he is concealing the truth. In October 1982
column22: Lindy is found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment with hard labour
column23: while Michael is found guilty as an accessory and given an 18-month suspended sentence. More than three years later
column24: while searching for the body of an English tourist who fell from Uluru
column25: police discover a small item of clothing that is identified as the jacket Lindy had insisted Azaria was wearing over her jumpsuit
column26: which had been recovered early in the investigation. She is immediately released from prison
column27: the case reopened and all convictions against the Chamberlains overturned."

column1: 5272176;End Game;The president is on his way to give a speech. While he is traveling there a man shows up with a camera. A reporter tries to ask a member of the secret service a question. When the president enters he is shot by the man with the camera. The president's main bodyguard
column2: Alex Thomas
column3: is grazed by the bullet that hits the president. The shooter is gunned down by Alex and other secret service agents. The president dies at the hospital. Kate Crawford
column4: an investigative journalist
column5: starts asking questions about the assassination. Anyone she questions is killed. She goes to Alex Thomas's house to tell him what is happening. As they head to his boat
column6: Thomas sees some men hiding in the bushes. He throws Kate into the water and dives in. Thomas jumps out of the water to kill two of the hitmen while a third hitman drives off to inform his boss what happened. They are able to link the hitmen to a man called Jack Baldwin . Agent Thomas and other Secret Service members attack the location of Jack Baldwin. Baldwin escapes but is later caught by Thomas. Thomas and Crawford are suspicious of Vaughan Stevens
column7: Agent Thomas's boss
column8: who had previous links to Baldwin. While reviewing film of the assassination at his house
column9: Thomas discovers that Stevens handed the assassin a gun during the president's entrance. Thomas leaves to find Stevens while Kate stays at his house. When Thomas arrives at Stevens' home he finds him dead. Before entering
column10: Thomas sees a car leaving the house. He then receives a call that Baldwin has escaped. Kate is attacked by Baldwin but Thomas arrives and kills Baldwin. Thomas arrives at the first lady's  home to see the car that left Steven's house pulling away. Thomas discovers that the first lady wanted her husband killed - due to the fact that the President was being unfaithful to her. A few weeks later Kate and Thomas have dinner. Thomas says that he still doesn't know who wanted the President dead.

column1: 1952976;Dark Water;"{{plot}} The film opens in 1974
column2: as a young girl
column3: Dahlia
column4: stands outside after school in the rain
column5: waiting for her mother. Flash forward to 2005
column6: we see a grown-up Dahlia  in the midst of a bitter mediation with ex-husband
column7: Kyle
column8: over custody of their daughter
column9: Cecilia . Kyle wants Cecilia to live closer to his apartment in Jersey City
column10: but Dahlia wants to move to Roosevelt Island
column11: where she has found a good school. Kyle threatens to sue for full custody because he feels the distance is too great. He also claims that Dahlia is ""mentally unstable."" Dahlia and Cecilia see an apartment in a complex on Roosevelt Island
column12: which is just a few blocks from Cecilia's new school. The superintendent of the dilapidated building is Mr. Veeck . The manager is Mr. Murray . During the tour
column13: Cecilia sneaks to the roof where she finds a Hello Kitty backpack near a large water tank. They leave the bag with Veeck
column14: and Murray promises Cecilia that she can have it if no one claims it. Cecilia
column15: who had disliked the apartment
column16: now wants desperately to live there. Dahlia agrees to move in. Shortly after
column17: the bedroom ceiling begins to leak dark water. The source is the apartment above
column19: where the Rimsky family lived up until a month ago. Dahlia enters 10F and finds it flooded
column20: with dark water flowing from every faucet
column21: the walls and toilet. She finds a family portrait of the former tenants—a mother
column22: father
column23: and a girl Cecilia's age. Dahlia complains to both Veeck and Murray about the water
column24: but the former does little about it despite the insistence of the latter. Dahlia soon has dreams of a little girl who appears to be Cecilia returning from a visit to her father's home
column25: but the girl's appearance changes every time Dahlia looks away
column26: so that she looks like the girl in the portrait in 10F. Cecilia has started school
column27: but according to her new teacher
column28: she isn't fitting in and is spending too much time with an imaginary friend
column29: named Natasha. A psychologist is recommended
column30: but Dahlia declines and tells Cecilia to ignore Natasha. Although Veeck had said it was claimed
column31: Dahlia discovers the Hello Kitty backpack in the laundry room's garbage. Cecilia later finds it in the elevator. The name in the backpack reads ""Natasha Rimsky"". The ceiling
column32: shoddily patched by Veeck
column33: leaks again. At school
column34: Cecilia appears to get into a fight with Natasha
column35: who appears to control her hand while painting. She's taken to the girls' bathroom where she passes out after dark water gushes from the toilets and sinks. Dahlia
column36: who is meeting with her lawyer
column37: can't be reached
column38: so Kyle picks her up and takes her to his apartment. Dahlia breaks down when she can't find her daughter and has strange dreams. These lead her to the roof and up the ladder of the water tank
column39: where she finds Natasha's body. When police arrive
column40: they discover that Natasha's father thought she was with her mother
column41: while the mother thought the girl was with her father. The girl was left alone in the abandoned apartment and fell into the water tank
column42: which Veeck had left open. He was aware of her body
column43: which was why he refused to fix the water problem plaguing the complex. Veeck is arrested and Murray is questioned. Dahlia agrees to move closer to Kyle so shared custody will go easier. As Dahlia packs
column44: Cecilia is taking a bath. A girl in a hooded bathrobe comes out of the bathroom
column45: wanting Dahlia to read to her. When she hears voices in the bathroom
column46: she realizes that the girl is Natasha. Natasha begs Dahlia not to leave her
column47: but Dahlia rushes into the bathroom to save Cecilia. Natasha then locks Cecilia in the shower compartment and holds her underwater. Dahlia pleads with Natasha
column48: promising to be her mother forever. Natasha lets Cecilia go and floods the apartment
column49: causing Dahlia to die from drowning. Her and Natasha's spirits are shown walking down the hallway. Kyle picks up Cecilia from the police station. Weeks later
column50: the two go back to pick up the rest of her stuff. Cecilia has a flashback of her and her mother looking at pictures together
column51: and in the elevator
column52: her mother's ghost braids her hair and comforts her—telling her she will always be there. Kyle
column53: momentarily horrified with a malfunction in the elevator
column54: the weird behavior of his daughter
column55: and perhaps noticing her hair had been braided
column56: finally takes her to his apartment in Jersey City."

column1: 24225279;Sing;The story begins with Hannah
column2: a young Jewish teen
column3: as she is completing her senior year of high school. Her small neighborhood in Brooklyn is falling apart and SING! is one of the only traditions keeping the neighborhood alive. Newly arrived teacher
column4: Miss Lombardo grew up in the neighborhood but returned to be their Sing Leader. One cold Christmas night
column5: Miss Lombardo is leaving a neighborhood party when a young man hails her a cab
column6: then attempts to mug her. In self defense
column7: she bites his hand to release his grip and he screams in pain and terror
column8: quickly making an exit. The cab driver jokes about not starting the meter yet. On the first day of school
column9: Miss Lombardo runs into difficulty when her students are uninterested and misbehaved. One such student was named Dominic who gets scolded for bringing stolen watches to school grounds and putting his feet up on the desk. On the day of Sing Leader elections
column10: Miss Lombardo recognizes Dominic as her mugger by the bandage on his hand and decides to blackmail him into being co-Sing Leader of the Senior class along with Hannah
column11: who was rightfully elected. The school kids work hard to plan their Sing productions. Hannah and Dominic clash along the way as Hannah uses traditional Sing planning strategies while Dominic wants to introduce the flavor of the youth in the neighborhood. In order to put Dominic and Hannah on the same page
column12: Miss Lombardo suggests that Hannah accompany Dominic to a local club. At first
column13: the two are equally hesitant but Hannah agrees on the terms that it is not a date. However
column14: by the end of the night
column15: Hannah uses Dominic to make her ex boyfriend
column16: Mickey
column17: jealous
column18: and due to this
column19: Hannah and Dominic start seeing each other in a different light. Dominic accompanies Hannah on her walk home and the two share a romantic kiss. Once the two are finally uniting and getting along
column20: the Dept. of Education informs the school that it will close its doors forever at the end of this semester and therefore
column21: there will not be enough resources for them to complete this year's Sing. This fuels the kids to work even harder on their productions and the neighborhood comes together even more to help finance the show
column22: despite the school authorities' ban. Ironically
column23: just as things are starting to look up
column24: Dominic reluctantly accompanies his brother on a robbery of Hannah's mother's diner
column25: their sole source of income which already was at risk of failure due to the school's upcoming closure. A classmate saw Dominic standing outside the diner at the time of the crime and informed Hannah of what he saw. Devastated
column26: Hannah confronts Dominic and he promises to get the money back for her. He then steals the money back from his brother and returns it to the diner
column27: restoring Hannah's faith in him. The recent events had discouraged Dominic from fulfilling his co-Sing leader duties and he had been skipping out on rehearsals. In a moment of great need as the senior's main performer falls unconscious
column28: Dominic steps in to save the show. He sheds his bad-boy demeanor and exceeds all expectations. The underclassmen and seniors perform to a record-high sold out audience. At the end of the show
column29: Hannah makes a moving speech motivating the community to rejoice and always remember that despite compromising circumstances
column30: they completed a successful Sing and proved their community's worth.

column1: 2462689;Meet John Doe;"Infuriated at being told to write one final column after being laid off from her newspaper job
column2: Ann Mitchell  prints a letter from a fictional unemployed ""John Doe"" threatening suicide on Christmas Eve in protest of society's ills. When the note causes a sensation and the paper's competition suspects a fraud and starts to investigate
column3: the newspaper editor rehires Mitchell who comes up with a scheme of hiding the fictional nature of ""John Doe"" while exploiting the sensation caused by the fake letter to boost the newspaper's sales
column4: for which she demands a bonus equal to 8 months' pay. After reviewing a number of derelicts who have shown up at the paper claiming to have penned the original suicide letter
column5: Mitchell and editor Henry Connell  hire John Willoughby
column6: a former baseball player and tramp who is in need of money to repair his injured arm
column7: to play John Doe. Mitchell now starts to pen an article series in Doe's name
column8: elaborating on the letter's ideas of society's disregard of people in need. Willoughby gets $50
column9: a new suit of clothes
column10: and a plush hotel suite with his tramp friend
column11: who launches into an extended diatribe against ""the heelots""
column12: lots of heels who incessantly focus on getting money from others. Willoughby is hired to give radio speeches
column13: guided by Mitchell who is promised $100 a week to write his speeches
column14: paid by the newspaper's publisher
column15: D.B. Norton ([[Edward Arnold . Willoughby turns down a $5
column16: 000 bribe to admit the whole thing was a publicity stunt
column17: gives Mitchell's speech
column18: and dashes off to the countryside with ""The Colonel"". They ride the rails
column19: playing the harmonica and ocarina until they show up in Millsville
column20: where John Doe is recognized at a diner. He's brought to City Hall
column21: where he's met by Hanson
column22: who gives a five-minute monologue about how he was inspired to start a local John Doe club. The John Doe philosophy spreads across the country
column23: developing into a broad grassroots movement whose simple slogan is
column24: ""Be a better neighbor"". Far from being an altruistic philanthropist
column25: however
column26: Norton plans to channel the support for Doe into support for his own national political ambitions. As a culmination of this plan
column27: Norton has instructed Mitchell to write a speech for Willoughby in which he announces the foundation of a new political party and endorses Norton as its presidential candidate. When Willoughby
column28: who has come to believe in the John Doe philosophy himself
column29: realizes that he is being used
column30: he tries to expose the plot
column31: but is first stymied in his attempts to talk his own mind to a nationwide radio audience at the rally instead of reading the prepared speech
column32: and then exposed as a fake by Norton
column33: who claims to have been deceived
column34: like everyone else
column35: by the staff of the newspaper. Frustrated by his failure
column36: Willoughby intends to commit suicide by jumping from the roof of the City Hall on Christmas Eve
column37: as indicated in the original John Doe letter. Only the intervention of Mitchell and followers of the John Doe clubs persuades him to renege on his threat to kill himself. At this point in the movie
column38: a reference to Jesus Christ is made
column39: that a historical ""John Doe"" has already died for the sake of humanity. The film ends with Connell turning to Norton and saying
column40: ""There you are
column41: Norton! The people! Try and lick that!"""

column1: 20532852;Destination Meatball;"A line of people  drool at the window of the shop of market butcher Buzz Buzzard. A short series of gags ensues about how Buzz dishonestly  ""jacks"" up all his prices. Since Woody is broke as usual
column2: he sneaks in and gets thrown out by Buzz. On the way out
column3: Woody collides with a bottle of invisible ink and turns partially invisible. Buzz can only see parts of Woody's body
column4: and
column5: in a somewhat gruesome scene
column6: thinks that he's been dismembered
column7: so he sweeps him into a trap door to get rid of him. When Woody awakes
column8: he realizes what is happening
column9: and he douses himself with the rest of the ink in order to pose as a ghost."

column1: 15401493;Husband for Hire;Lola  attempts to gain her father's trust fund  by hiring a Hispanic husband
column2: Bo
column3: offering him $100
column4: 000 per year if he marries her. Bo accepts
column5: and then departs from his Texas home and returns with Lola to her home in New Mexico. Lola finds out he is in fact Caucasian. Lola's best friend
column6: Nina
column7: and Bo's brother  join the trip
column8: as does Bo's girlfriend
column9: Nikki
column10: and her clumsy friend
column11: Dotty
column12: in secret. When introduced to Bo
column13: Lola's father
column14: Victor
column15: refuses to allow them to get married
column16: until Bo convinces him by playing an antique guitar. In the mean time
column17: Lola's ex-fiancé
column18: Marco
column19: and his secret girlfriend
column20: Simona
column21: who is also Lola's sister trying to keep her from having the inheritance
column22: plot against Lola in order to gain the trust fund for themselves. Throughout the course of the story
column23: Lola and Bo actually fall for each other. However
column24: after Simona discovers Bo and Lola have a plot of their own
column25: she uses Nikki to ruin the plot. However
column26: before Nikki could do any damage
column27: Victor and Bo get into an argument
column28: which has both Lola and her father kick Bo out. In response
column29: Lola's ex-fiancé is able to win back Lola's heart
column30: but Lola only agrees for the money. Later that night

column1: 18188932;Up and Down;Milan and Goran are two criminals who smuggle illegal immigrants. One night after they complete a smuggle
column2: they discover that one of the immigrants has left a baby behind. Milan and Goran decide to sell the baby to Lubos and Eman
column3: who are responsible for running an illegal baby adoption center. Lubos and Eman make attempts to sell the baby to Miluska and Frantisek
column4: a barren couple. Concurrently a university professor is diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor
column5: setting into action a complicated train of family reunions
column6: partings
column7: and conflicts.

column1: 2940516;Ghost In The Noonday Sun;Bumbling pirate crewman  kills his captain after learning where he has hidden buried treasure. However as he begins to lose his memory
column2: he relies more and more on the ghost of the man he's murdered to help him find the treasure. This film provided a reunion of sorts for Sellers with his onetime Goon Show colleague Spike Milligan

column1: 1335380;Exodus;"The film is based on the events that happened on the ship Exodus in 1947 as well as events dealing with the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. Nurse Katherine ""Kitty"" Fremont  is an American volunteer at the Karaolos internment camp on Cyprus
column2: where thousands of Jews - Holocaust survivors - are being held by the British
column3: who won't let them go to Palestine. They anxiously wait for the day they will be liberated. Ari Ben Canaan
column4: a Hagannah rebel who previously was a captain in the Jewish Brigade of the British Army in the Second World War
column5: obtains a cargo ship and smuggles 611 Jewish inmates out of the camp for an illegal voyage to Mandate Palestine before being discovered by military authorities. When the British find out that the refugees are in a ship in the harbor of Famagusta
column6: they blockade it. The refugees stage a hunger strike
column7: during which the camp's doctor dies
column8: and Ari threatens to blow up the ship and the refugees. The British relent and allow the Exodus safe passage. Meanwhile
column9: Kitty has grown very fond of Karen Hansen
column10: a young Danish-Jewish girl searching for her father
column11: from whom she was separated during the war. She has taken up the Zionist cause
column12: much to the chagrin of Kitty
column13: who had hoped to take young Karen to America so that she can begin a new life there. During this time
column14: opposition to the partition of Palestine into Arab and Jewish states is heating up
column15: and Karen's young beau Dov Landau  proclaims his desire to join the Irgun
column16: a radical Zionist underground network. Dov goes to an Irgun address
column17: only to get caught in a police trap. After he is freed
column18: he is contacted by members of the Irgun and is interviewed by Ari Ben Canaan's uncle Akiva . Before swearing Dov in
column19: Akiva forces the boy to confess that he was a Sonderkommando in Auschwitz and that he was raped by Nazis. Due to his activities
column20: Akiva has been disowned by Ari's father
column21: Barak
column22: who heads the mainstream Jewish Agency trying to create a Jewish state through political and diplomatic means. He fears that the Irgun will damage his efforts
column23: especially since the British have put a price on Akiva's head. When Dov successfully bombs the King David Hotel in an act of terrorism
column24: leading to dozens of fatalities
column25: Akiva is arrested and sentenced to hang. Meanwhile
column26: Karen's father has been found
column27: but he is ill in hospital in Jerusalem and does not recognize her. Karen has gone to live at Gan Dafna
column28: a fictional Jewish kibbutz near Mount Tabor at which Ari was raised. An actual kibbutz named Dafna is located near the present Lebanese border. Kitty and Ari have fallen in love
column29: but uncle Akiva's imprisonment is an obstacle
column30: and Ari must devise a plan to free the prisoners. Dov Landau
column31: who had managed to elude the arresting soldiers
column32: turns himself in so that he can use his knowledge of explosives to rig the Acre prison and plan an escape route. All goes according to plan; hundreds of prisoners
column33: including Akiva
column34: manage to escape. For the historical incident on which this is based
column35: see Acre Prison break. Akiva is fatally shot by British soldiers while evading a roadblock set up to catch the escaped prisoners. Ari is also badly wounded. He makes his way to Abu Yesha
column36: an Arab village near Gan Dafna
column37: where his lifelong friend
column38: Taha
column39: is the mukhtar. Kitty is brought there and treats his wound. An independent Israel is now in plain view
column40: but Arab nationals commanded by Mohammad Amin al-Husayni
column41: the Grand Mufti of Jerusalem
column42: plot to attack Gan Dafna and kill its villagers. Ari receives prior warning of this attack from Taha
column43: and he manages to get the younger children of the town out in a mass overnight escape. Karen
column44: ecstatic over the prospect of a new nation
column45: finds Dov  and proclaims her love for him; Dov assures her that they will marry someday. As Karen returns to Gan Dafna
column46: she is ambushed and killed by a gang of Arab militiamen. Dov discovers her lifeless body the following morning. That same day
column47: the body of Taha is found hanging in his village
column48: killed by Arab extremists with a Star of David symbol carved on his body. Karen and Taha are buried together in one grave. At the Jewish burial ceremony
column49: Ari swears on their bodies that someday
column50: Jews and Arabs will live together and share the land in peace
column51: not only in death but also in life. The movie then ends with Ari
column52: Kitty
column53: and a Palmach contingent entering trucks and heading toward battle."

column1: 1480747;House Party 2;"{{plot}} Following the sudden death of Kid's father ""Pop"" the local church has donated a scholarship fund to Kid so that he can go to college. Play now drives a sports car called ""Foreplay"" and is the manager of a record store. He attracts the attention of music producer Shelia Landreaux whose talent scout Rick spotted Kid N' Play performing at a community center. Shelia is willing to help finance Kid N'Play's demo session if they can commit to taking the act to the top of the charts. Kid however immediately backs out because he can't commit to the act and go to school
column2: causing a rift between the two friends. Kid and Sydney both move into new student accommodations where Kid's room mate is Jamal
column3: a white rapper and Sydney moves in with Zora
column4: a strong minded female student who embraces strong political correctness. Meanwhile
column5: Play meets a beautiful older woman named Salena who he flirts with and offers to help her with any thing she needs. Unfortunately
column6: Bilal arrives and causes Play to stop flirting with Salena but she assures him that she'll back. Zora encourages Sydney to take courses that focus on more feminist perspectives and slowly Kid and Sydney begin to drift apart. While buying books for his studies
column7: Kid's tuition cheque bounces and he is sent to the finance office where first he meets Miles
column8: the Dean's assistant who tells him not to be intimidated. Kid calls Play  about his money and Play quickly assures him that his money is in a safe place. Back on campus
column9: Kid then meets Dean Kramer who destroys Kid's student ID and gives him a week to pay his tuition fee. Miles tells Kid he can ""hook him up"" with an extension by getting his friend to make changes on the main computer for a small price. Kid gives Miles all the money he has left for the hook up. Meanwhile
column10: Shelia Landreaux approaches Play after Rick apparently takes off with the money that was supposedly for Kid n' Play's demo session so he can clear his gambling debts. Play hesitantly gives Shelia Kid's scholarship cheque and faces a grilling from Bilal. Kid arrives later on demanding answers from Play as to the whereabouts of his money. Play comes clean to Kid and convinces him to ride to the recording studio where he promises Shelia will be with the money. Kid
column11: Play and Bilal arrive at ""Do Me Records"" but are denied access into the building as the secretary has not heard of the names Shelia Landreaux or Play. Play is then confronted by Stab
column12: Zilla and Pee Wee who want to know when they are going to record their demo. The trio were led to believe that Shelia gave Play their money for their demo session. As everyone argues the police arrive and warn them never to give money to any women by the name of Shelia Landreaux who also goes by several other alias'. Kid and Play get into a fight and Bilal then convinces Kid to ask Sydney for money. Kid tries to approache Sydney but Sydney assumes that he wants to break up with her. Kid doesn't know how to tell her why he really approached her so the two decide to stop seeing each other. Kid takes a job in the faculty dining hall to make ends meet. Things get worse when his lecturer
column13: Professor Sinclair
column14: gives him a week to write a 20 page paper or face failing his class. However without a student ID and with Stab
column15: Zilla and Pee Wee working as campus security Kid can no longer get into the library or cafeteria and relies on Jamal for support as he balances work and study. Meanwhile
column16: Play's new girlfriend Salena comes by angry at Play for not calling her about the demo. He assures her he'll let her know as soon as possible. Later
column17: Bilal
column18: who frequently convinces Play to give him personal discounts on records reminds him one day that ""sometimes you've gotta pay what you owe"". Play then approaches Kid with a plan to make the money back: A Pajama party where men pay entry fee and women ""appropriately dressed"" get in for free. However
column19: Play and Bilal run amok on campus such as Bilal having sex with a stranger girl and Kid walking in on Play and Salena in his dorm. Play wants to hold the party in the faculty dining hall which would mean Kid having to get the key and risk getting into trouble with his boss Mr Lee. Kid is against this idea and instead tries to reconcile with Sydney but sees her getting close to Miles at a protest rally. After Mr Lee is informed that Kid is no longer a student he is dismissed of his duties and sent back to Dean Kramer. Kid manages to get his deadline extended another week giving him enough time to plan for the party. Kid
column20: Play
column21: Bilal and Jamal begin spreading word on campus about the party. Later on the party is in full swing. Sydney arrives hoping to talk to Kid but after seeing him getting close to another student she decides to go with Miles. Zora is approached by Rick and Shelia who is now going by another alias. While Kid N'Play perform on stage
column22: Kid is distracted by Miles who forces Sydney into drinking beer. He jumps off stage to rescue Sydney. Play spots Shelia and Rick and chases after them. Zora knocks Shelia out with a punch to the face while Sydney tries to get away from Miles. Miles eventually lets go off Sydney and runs off with Kid in hot pursuit. A chase occurs around the building involving Kid
column23: Miles
column24: Rick
column25: Play and campus security. Kid finally confronts Miles on the roof who tries to swing at Kid but falls through the glass roof and lands flat in huge cake. The party is eventually stopped by Dean Kramer and the police. Miles tries to escape but he is caught by Stab
column26: Zilla
column27: and Pee-Wee. The police try to arrest them but Play explains the whole situation to Dean Kramer
column28: who promptly fires Miles and has Rick and Shelia arrested instead. He then tells Kid that the room needs to be changed back to the way it was by morning or face expulsion. As Kid
column29: Play
column30: Bilal and Jamal frantically clean up Kid is approached by Mr Lee. A reluctant Play gives Kid the money they made and Kid hands it over to Mr Lee hoping it will pay for the damages. The next day Kid informs Mr Lee and then Professor Sinclair of his departure citing that he hadn't proven he belonged at college. Professor Sinclair had thought otherwise revealing he had given Kid an A minus for his 20 page paper. He offers Kid a job as his teaching assistant but Kid declines because it wouldn't cover all his expenses. Kid heads over to Pops grave where he apologizes for letting him down. Play attempts to talk to Kid but he is too upset. Kid then packs up the rest of his stuff and says goodbye to Jamal and Sydney. He also finally wins the respect of Stab
column31: Zilla and Pee Wee. They ride pass and tell him they got a job working on the police force. Play and Bilal pull up with their girlfriends in Play's old car. Play sold ""Foreplay"" and gives the money to Kid. He admits to being the one who forced Kid to drop out of college in the first place and apologizes. Play tells Kid to go back inside and study. As Play and Bilal drive away
column32: Kid looks up to the heavens and says thanks to Pop."

column1: 24448645;Forest of the Damned 2;Despite Lucy's reservations
column2: she agrees to her husband’s request to attend a wild party of lust and sexual exploration on a remote island. Their passion soon turns to terror when they discover that one of the group has disappeared. Some start to believe there is something evil lurking in the forest while others begin to suspect each other. Lucy's biggest fear was that the weekend could ruin her marriage
column3: she didn't realize it could cost her her life too.

column1: 4018288;The Biggest Fan;"Debbie's favorite band is Dream Street
column2: and her favorite member is Chris Trousdale. When Chris gets a fever while travelling on the Dream Street tour
column3: in a haze
column4: he strays away and ends up in Debbie's bed
column5: much to the shock of his ""Biggest Fan
column6: who thinks she's in heaven. Debbie proposes that Chris stay with her and he agrees. So

column1: 4596602;Ashes to Ashes;Ashes to Ashes is set in London
column2: England. The film is a surreal journey into the dreams and misadventures of Gabriel Darbeaux a young screenwriter and martial arts enthusiast who supplements his income by escorting wealthy women. We are introduced to Gabriel’s character as he is chased and cornered by a group of Triad thugs armed with swords
column3: sticks and nunchaku. Using his own nunchaku Gabriel manages to fight off the thugs only to find that the whole episode was an early morning dream. The dream provides inspiration for the opening scene of his latest screenplay entitled ‘Ashes to Ashes’ a thriller involving the Italian Mafia
column4: Chinese Triads and a generous amount of martial arts action. While Gabriel believes that the success of this script will give him financial independence
column5: his best friend Michael has plans of setting up his own escort agency. To fund this project
column6: he resorts to making secret recordings of his sexual encounters with a banker’s wife and hopes to earn £100
column7: 000 through blackmail. Gabriel receives a call to meet with one of his regular clients at an exclusive restaurant in the West End of London. The woman fails to show and instead Gabriel encounters the beautiful Arabella Simone who draws him into a world which is disturbingly similar to that featured in his screenplay for Ashes to Ashes. Arabella is the former mistress to Valentino Tarantola
column8: a possessive Italian gangster who employs ‘Laundrymen’ Muhammed and Nelson to do his dirty work. When Valentino is apparently castrated and left for dead at Arabella’s apartment she runs to Gabriel for help with the ‘Laundrymen’ close on her tail. Michael is called in to drive the two to a main line station from where they plan to take a train to France. Unfortunately
column9: before the trio get very far
column10: they are captured by the ‘Laundrymen’ and taken to a warehouse where they are introduced to Enrico Tarontola
column11: Valentino’s sadistic younger brother. Bound and gagged
column12: they are forced to listen helplessly as Enrico accuses Arabella of castrating and killing his brother Valentino and Michael of blackmailing his financial advisor’s wife. All three
column13: including Gabriel are to be put to a violent death. Without warning
column14: henchmen of a rival Triad boss storm the warehouse. In the ensuing battle
column15: Gabriel is forced to fight for his life against Triad enforcers and Mafia hitmen. The film ends with Gabriel waking from a violent dream blurring the distinction between dream
column16: reality and the fictional account that Gabriel is writing.

column1: 15224586;Green Dragon;The film follows the experience of Vietnamese refugees in the United States immediately following the Fall of Saigon at the end of the Vietnam War. Tai Tran  has been appointed the camp translator by Gunnery Sgt. Jim Lance . He has arrived with his sister's two young children. Their mother is believed to have been lost in the rush to leave Vietnam. Despite the despair of leaving Vietnam and having to live in an unfamiliar United States
column2: many of the occupants make adjustments. Minh  is silent and solitary until he meets Addie
column3: the camp's cook. They embark on a friendship to the point where Minh is drawn out of his shell. Meanwhile
column4: Tai and his friend Duc  find themselves enamored with two female refugees. Tai falls for Thuy Hoa
column5: the daughter of a discredited Vietnamese general. Duc falls back in love with a former girlfriend from Vietnam who is an unhappily married second wife.

column1: 15585766;The Rats of Tobruk;Three friends are droving cattle in Australia in 1939: the restless Bluey Donkin
column2: easy-going Milo Trent and English Peter Linton
column3: who is in the country on a working holiday. Squatter's daughter Kate Carmody is in love with Bluey but he refuses to be tied down to any one woman. War is breaks out and the three men enlist in the Australian army and are assigned to the 9th Division. They ship out to Africa. After early successes against the Italian army
column4: the army is besieged in Tobruk. In between attacks
column5: the men have comic encounters with a barber and Peter falls for a nurse
column6: Sister Mary
column7: after being wounded. There are several subsequent attacks in which all three soldiers are wounded. Peter Linton is killed but the others manage to repel the Germans. Bluey and Milo are then transferred to New Guinea
column8: where Bluey is injured and Milo killed by a sniper. Bluey manages to kill the sniper and returns to Australia
column9: where he is reunited with Kate.

column1: 1760737;Red's Dream;"Set in a lonely city on a rainy night
column2: the film takes place in a bicycle shop  that is closed for the night. In the corner of the shop sleeps Red
column3: a red unicycle who languishes in the ""clearance corner""
column4: waiting to be purchased. As the camera zooms on him
column5: the sound of rain falling turns into a drumroll
column6: and we go into the dream-sequence. In his dream
column7: Red is being ridden by a circus clown  as part of a juggling act. The clown enters the ring
column8: accompanied by a fanfare
column9: expecting a huge applause
column10: but instead receives only a few scattered claps from different parts of the  audience. Nevertheless
column11: Lumpy starts juggling three balls whilst riding Red
column12: occasionally dropping them as he does. However
column13: Red slides out from underneath Lumpy  and spikes the balls back to him with his bike pedals. The confused clown ponders this for only a second before continuing on with his act. At this point
column14: Red is forced to catch another ball which Lumpy unintentionally throws across the ring. Lumpy continues to ride in the air while juggling the other two balls while Red bounces the green ball up and down. Eventually Lumpy comes to a sudden realization
column15: and looks between his legs
column16: only to discover he's been riding on nothing before he falls to the ground . Red catches the other two balls and begins juggling all three of them
column17: and then balances them on top of each other
column18: after which he receives an uproarous applause. But then the sound of clapping turns into the sound of rain
column19: and Red awakens
column20: left to face bleak reality. Depressed
column21: he returns to the corner where he was previously resting
column22: and goes back to sleep. The short ends with the final image of the neon sign for ""Eben's Bikes""."

column1: 29062594;A la salida nos vemos;A group of teenagers at Catholic boarding school in the provinces spend their time trying to adapt to the demands of the priest in charge of the school while discovering life with their adventures and pains. It presents the romantic and sexual initiation of the group of adolescent boys and their problems.

29326153;Class of '61;The film follows the lives of several West Point cadet classmates who find themselves on opposite sides of the war. The film also follows the adventures of Lucius the slave escaping via the underground railroad to freedom with the film cutting between the First Battle of Bull Run and the birth of a Lucius' child born in slavery.
9252321;Come Back
column2: Africa;This story of a Zulu family is a composite story of events enacted by Africans whose experiences resembled the story’s events. Forced out of his village by famine
column3: Zachariah leaves his family to take the only work available: in the gold mines near Johannesburg. Seeking better than a slave wage
column4: he settles with his wife and children in a bleak room in a crumbling shack on the outskirts of the city. Here he confronts the pass laws – hundreds of laws which he did not know existed – restricting his every move: he cannot find work without a pass
column5: and he cannot get a pass without work. At the same time he is constantly threatened with banishment or imprisonment if he is unemployed too long
column6: or fails to comply with petty restrictions. Zachariah drifts through a succession of jobs – domestic servant
column7: garage attendant
column8: waiter
column9: road gang laborer – tormented
column10: insulted
column11: and degraded by white employers who summarily dismiss him because of his ignorance or out of malice. In addition
column12: he falls foul of Marumu
column13: the leader of a gang of “tsotsis”  who are terrorizing the streets of Sophiatown. Fearful that poverty will drive her son to the street gangs
column14: his wife takes a job as a domestic servant where she must live on premises
column15: separated from her family. Zachariah is caught sleeping with Vinah during a nightly police raid and is arrested for trespassing. He returns from prison to find his wife dead
column16: murdered by Murumu because she refused to give in to his sexual demands. Inexorably Zachariah’s overwhelming helplessness and frustration reveal the social impoverishment of all African men
column17: women
column18: and children. Starved off the land after confiscation by successive governments
column19: the black man is uprooted from his native soil and forced continually to search for a home and livelihood. Deprived of political power
column20: he must weave a treacherous path of survival among the myriad written and unwritten laws that govern black contact with the white world – laws which are often contradictory and inevitably result in severe penalties. The family is increasingly torn apart when both parents must work to buy bread
column21: leaving their children to grow up amid the violence and filth of the streets. In the end
column22: the African is completely defenseless in his struggle to survive
column23: inhumanely pulled between the capricious brutality of white law and the wanton violence of the black outlaw.

column1: 8388648;Nee Sneham;The film opens with Madhav  and Sreenu  playing a football cup final in Kolkata. Madhav and Sreenu are best friends
column2: football players
column3: and neighbours. Subsequently
column4: the team wins the cup. A mishap happens when Sreenu tries to save Madhav from an accident. Madhav escapes with minor injuries
column5: but Sreenu loses his leg. This puts an end to his football career. Sreenu
column6: recovering from the incident
column7: convinces Madhav not to tell anyone about the cause of Sreenu's accident. He does this to save the two families from drifting apart. Remembering his sacrifice
column8: Madhav works hard and becomes the captain of the team
column9: a post once held by Sreenu. Once
column10: while visiting Goa for a match
column11: Madhav sees Amrutha  and falls in love with her. When Amrutha returns to her house
column12: she finds her grandparents fixing her marriage with an NRI. The marriage breaks apart when the father of the groom gets to know about Madhav's love for Amrutha. Her heartbroken grandfather dies a few days later
column13: and Amrutha holds Madhav responsible for all these incidents and starts hating him. Madhav tries to change her life by anonymously sending her gifts and money during her hardships. Amrutha desperately tries to find the person who was sending these to her. A few days later
column14: during the festival of Holi
column15: Amrutha mistakenly thinks Sreenu to be the sender of all the gifts and proposes him for marriage. Sreenu
column16: not knowing about Madhav's love
column17: agrees to the proposal. Madhav rushes to Sreenu's house
column18: where he realises that the bride is no one else but Amrutha. Madhav sacrifices his love for his best friend's happiness. He tries to burn the photos of him and Amrutha in Goa
column19: but he is seen by his father. His father gets to know the truth but Madhav convinces him not to tell anyone. Madhav decides to leave the town so that the marriage goes on smoothly. He fakes a letter asking him to report to Delhi for national football team selection. Sreenu asks him to leave immediately and to fulfill both of their dreams. Madhav
column20: instead of going to Delhi
column21: flies to Mumbai. Meanwhile
column22: Sreenu's father learns about the photograph and Amrutha is questioned about their relationship. Amrutha realises that it was Madhav
column23: and not Sreenu
column24: who helped her. Sreenu and Amrutha leave for Mumbai. The film ends with Amrutha and Madhav getting together and Sreenu walking away with satisfaction.

column1: 10644072;Bhagwan Dada;A villager new to the big city – Bhagwaan  – turns to crime to avoid starvation. He is drawn into the gang of slum crime lord ‘dada’ Shambu  where he falls into every crime but one: violence against women. When an impoverished but honourable young widow hangs herself after being raped by Shambu Dada
column2: the cries of her orphaned baby awaken Bhagwaan’s soul. He rebels against his former master. Bhagwaan vows to atone for his formerly evil life
column3: and adopts the orphaned baby as his own son. The innocent young boy becomes Bhagwaan’s source of personal redemption and the inspiration for all that he does. 12 years later the man now lovingly hailed as “Bhagwaan Dada” has transformed the former crime-ridden slum into a safe and happy neighbourhood - Shantinagar - where his adopted son Govinda  has become the pride and joy of the whole community. Despite his own dark past
column4: this loving father has worked hard to raise the boy as a good person with sound moral values. At this time
column5: Bhagwaan chances to rescue another naïve young man new to the big city – Swaroop  – when Shambu Dada’s gang steal all Swaroop’s money. Impressed with Swaroop’s education as well as the similarity of situation to his own arrival in the city years before
column6: Bhagwaan takes the “innocent and simple” villager under his protective wing. He arranges a good job
column7: even brings Swaroop home to live with himself and his son
column8: young Govinda. Swaroop and Bhagwaan claim each other as ‘brothers’. One day on a roadway nearby the district
column9: members of Shambu Dada’s gang assault a beautiful young woman whom Shambu lusts after. Swaroop hears her cries for help and tries to rescue her
column10: believing as Bhagwaan does that: “It is every man’s duty to honour and protect women.” But Swaroop is a gentle bookish soul who does not know how to fight. He is badly beaten by Shambu’s men before Bhagwaan can rescue him in turn. The young woman  who gives her name as Bijli insists on tending the wounded Swaroop who bravely tried to help her. Bhagwaan invites Bijli to come live at their house until she can find a place to stay. After some initial confusion when Govinda mistakes Bijli for his new ‘uncle’ Swaroop’s wife
column11: all four of them – Bhagwaan
column12: Govinda
column13: Swaroop
column14: and now Bijli – live happily in Bhagwaan’s modest home
column15: Govinda remaining impishly determined to matchmake between Swaroop and Bijli. However
column16: what neither Bhagwaan nor Swaroop realise is that Bijli is a streetwalker. Intercepted on her way out to work one evening
column17: Bijli spills Bhagwaan a yarn about how she is secretly an undercover policewoman assigned to pose as a prostitute in order to arrest real prostitutes and their patrons. Bhagwaan believes her. He preserves her ‘secret’
column18: and all four continue happily in the house just as before
column19: ignorance being bliss. The audience soon learn
column20: though
column21: that appearances are deceiving: Bijli is not
column22: actually
column23: a sex worker but rather working a fraud scam wherein she bilks potential ‘johns’ of money through clever ruses. Meanwhile
column24: Shambu Dada has sworn revenge against Bhagwaan for foiling his plan to abduct Bijli. After brutally beating to death one of his gangmembers who botched the abduction
column25: Shambu dumps the corpse in Bhagwaan’s territory seeking to frame Bhagwaan for the murder. The honest policeman Inspector Vijay
column26: though
column27: is fully aware of Shambu Dada’s crime empire activities as well as Bhagwaan’s reformation. When Bhagwaan discovers the corpse and duly reports the murder
column28: Inspector Vijay not only fails to arrest Bhagwaan but even introduces Bhagwaan to a newspaper reporter – Madhu  – who is researching crime trends in the city

column1: 5414895;Red Cliff;"Director John Woo said in an interview with David Stratton that the film is only 50% factual. Woo decided to alter the story using modern feelings and his own feelings for a more worldly acceptance. According to Woo
column2: historical accuracy was less important than how the audience felt about the battle.http://www.abc.net.au/atthemovies/txt/s2616304.htm  In the summer of 208
column3: during the Han Dynasty
column4: the imperial army led by chancellor Cao Cao embarks on a campaign to eliminate the southern warlords Sun Quan and Liu Bei in the name of eradicating rebels
column5: with the reluctant approval of Emperor Xian. Cao Cao's mighty army swiftly conquers Jing Province and the Battle of Changban is ignited when Cao's cavalry starts attacking civilians on an exodus led by Liu Bei. During the battle
column6: Liu Bei's followers
column7: including his sworn brothers Guan Yu and Zhang Fei
column8: give an excellent display of their combat skills by holding off the enemy while buying time for the civilians to retreat. The warrior Zhao Yun fights bravely to rescue Liu Bei's entrapped family but only succeeds in rescuing Liu's infant son. Following the battle
column9: Liu Bei's advisor Zhuge Liang embarks on a diplomatic mission to Jiangdong to form an alliance between his lord and Sun Quan to deal with Cao Cao's invasion. Sun Quan was initially in the midst of a dilemma of whether to surrender or resist
column10: but his decision to resist Cao Cao hardens after Zhuge Liang's clever persuasion and a subsequent tiger hunt with his viceroy Zhou Yu and sister Sun Shangxiang. Meanwhile
column11: naval commanders Cai Mao and Zhang Yun from Jing Province pledge allegiance to Cao Cao and are received warmly by Cao
column12: who places them in command of his navy. After the hasty formation of the alliance
column13: the forces of Liu Bei and Sun Quan call for a meeting to formulate a plan to counter Cao Cao's army
column14: which is rapidly advancing towards Red Cliff from both land and water. The battle begins with Sun Shangxiang leading a light cavalry unit to lure Cao Cao's vanguard force into the allies' Bagua Formation. The vanguard force is defeated by the allies but Cao Cao shows no disappointment and proceeds to lead his main army to the riverbank directly opposite the allies' main camp
column15: where they make camp. While the allies throw a banquet to celebrate their victory
column16: Zhuge Liang thinks of a plan to send Sun Shangxiang to infiltrate Cao Cao's camp and conduct an espionage mission. The duo maintain contact by sending messages via a pigeon. The film ends with Zhou Yu lighting his miniaturised battleships on a map based on the battle formation.  Sun Shangxiang has infiltrated Cao Cao's camp and is secretly noting details and sending them via a pigeon to Zhuge Liang. Meanwhile
column17: Cao Cao's army is seized with a plague of typhoid fever that kills a number of his troops. Cao Cao orders the corpses to be sent on floating rafts to the allies' camp
column18: hoping to pass the plague on to his enemies. The allied army's morale is affected when some unsuspecting soldiers let the plague in
column19: and eventually a disheartened Liu Bei leaves with his forces while Zhuge Liang stays behind to assist Sun Quan's forces. Cao Cao is overjoyed when he hears that the alliance had collapsed. At the same time
column20: Cai Mao and Zhang Yun propose a new tactic of interlocking the battleships together with iron beams to minimize rocking when sailing on the river and reduce the chances of the troops falling seasick. [[Image:Red Cliff.jpg|right|thumb|Sun Quan's forces look on as Liu Bei leaves the alliance. From right to left: Zhou Yu
column21: Sun Quan
column22: Lu Su (Hou Yong . Subsequently
column23: Zhou Yu and Zhuge Liang make plans on how to eliminate Cai Mao and Zhang Yun
column24: and produce 100
column25: 000 arrows respectively. They agreed that whoever fails to complete his mission will be punished by execution under military law. Zhuge Liang's ingenious strategy of letting the enemy shoot 20 boats covered in straw brings in over 100
column26: 000 arrows from the enemy and makes Cao Cao doubt the loyalty of Cai Mao and Zhang Yun. On the other hand
column27: Cao Cao sends Jiang Gan to persuade Zhou Yu to surrender
column28: but Zhou tricks Jiang instead into believing that Cai Mao and Zhang Yun are planning to assassinate Cao. Both Zhuge Liang and Zhou Yu's respective plans complement each other when Cao Cao is convinced
column29: despite earlier having doubts about Jiang Gan's report
column30: that Cai Mao and Zhang Yun were indeed planning to assassinate him by deliberately ""donating"" arrows to the enemy. Cai Mao and Zhang Yun are executed and Cao Cao realises his folly afterwards but it is too late. In Sun Quan's camp
column31: Sun Shangxiang returns from Cao Cao's camp with a map of the enemy formation. Zhou Yu and Zhuge Liang decide to attack Cao Cao's navy with fire anticipating that a special climatic condition will soon cause the wind to shift and that the resulting southeast wind will blow to their advantage. Before the battle
column32: Sun Quan's forces have a final moment together
column33: feasting on rice dumplings to celebrate the Winter Solstice. Meanwhile
column34: Zhou Yu's wife
column35: Xiaoqiao
column36: heads towards Cao Cao's camp alone secretly
column37: hoping to persuade Cao to give up his ambitious plans
column38: but fails and decides to distract him instead to buy time for her side. The battle begins when the southeast wind starts blowing in the middle of the night and Sun Quan's forces launch their attack on Cao Cao's navy. On the other hand
column39: Liu Bei's forces
column40: which had apparently left the alliance
column41: start attacking Cao Cao's forts on land. By dawn
column42: Cao Cao's entire navy has been destroyed. The allies launch another offensive on Cao Cao's ground army
column43: stationed in his forts
column44: and succeed in breaking through using testudo formation despite suffering heavy casualties. Although Cao Cao is besieged in his main camp
column45: he manages to hold Zhou Yu hostage after catching him off guard together with Cao Hong. Xiahou Jun also appears
column46: holding Xiaoqiao hostage and causing the allies to hesitate. Just then
column47: Zhao Yun manages to reverse the situation by rescuing Xiaoqiao with a surprise attack and put Cao Cao at the mercy of the allies instead. Eventually
column48: the allies decide to spare Cao Cao's life and tell him never to return before leaving for home. In the final scene

The Western release trimmed the length of the film from 280 minutes to 148 minutes and was released in some regions under the title Battle of Red Cliff. An opening narration in English is provided to set the historical context whereas in the Asian release
column50: a more brief description of the context of the political situation appears in scrolling form 10 minutes into the film. Notable cuts include the background and motivations behind Zhuge Liang's plan to obtain 100
column51: 000 arrows
column52: including the threat to his life

Both parts were later released together as a two-disc set in North America by Magnolia Entertainment in their original length on both DVD and Blu-ray disc formats on 23 March

column2: the Bad
column3: the Weird;"In the desert wilderness of 1930s Manchuria
column4: The Bad  - a bandit and hitman - is hired to acquire a treasure map from a Japanese official traveling by train. Before he can get it however
column5: The Weird  - a thief  - steals the map and is caught up in The Bad's derailment of the train. This involves the slaughter of the Japanese and Manchurian guards
column6: and various civilians. The Good  - an eagle-eyed bounty hunter - appears on the scene to claim the bounty on The Bad. Meanwhile The Weird escapes
column7: eluding his Good and Bad pursuers. A third force - a group of Manchurian bandits - also want the map to sell to the Ghost Market. The Weird hopes to uncover the map's secrets and recover what he believes is gold and riches buried by the Qing Dynasty just before the collapse of their government. As the story continues
column8: an escalating battle for the map occurs
column9: with bounties placed on heads and the Imperial Japanese Army racing to reclaim its map as it can apparently ""save the Japanese Empire"". After a series of graphic shoot-outs and chases
column10: a final battle erupts in which the Japanese army
column11: Manchurian bandits
column12: The Good
column13: The Bad and his gang are chasing The Weird all at once. The Japanese army kills most of the bandits. The Good kills many Japanese soldiers and sets off an explosion that drives them away. The Bad's gang is slowly killed off and he kills those that attempt to leave the chase. Only the Bad
column14: the Weird and the Good make it to the ""treasure"". However
column15: they find that it is nothing more than a boarded-over hole in the desert. The Bad recognizes The Weird as the ""Finger Chopper"" - a criminal that cut off his finger in a knife fight five years ago - and the man that the Good had thought the Bad to be. Turning on each other in a final act of vengeance for the slights they suffered
column16: they finally gun each other down after a prolonged Mexican standoff. The three lay in the sand
column17: dying and alone
column18: as the ""useless hole"" they had fought and died for suddenly and belatedly erupts with a geyser of crude oil. The Good does survive along with the Weird. With a newly raised bounty on the Weird
column19: a new chase begins as he flees across the Manchurian desert."

column1: 17711304;Rendezvous;"In 1917
column2: former newspaperman William Gordon  enlists in the U.S. Army. The day before he is to leave Washington
column3: D.C. for the fighting in Europe
column4: he meets socialite Joel Carter . The couple spend the day together. He tells her that
column5: because he once wrote a book on cryptography under a pen name
column6: the army is searching for him to put him to work behind a desk
column7: but he is eager to fight the Germans. The next day
column8: just before he boards his train
column9: Lieutenant Gordon is ordered to report to John Carter
column10: the Assistant Secretary of War. He reassigns the unhappy Gordon to Major William Brennan  to spend the war decoding German transmissions. He learns that Joel had revealed his secret to her uncle
column11: John Carter
column12: in order to keep him around. The U.S. is preparing to send its army across the Atlantic Ocean
column13: but there are grave worries about the U-boat threat. Brennan comes up with the idea to have British escorts meet American transports before they enter the most dangerous zone. For maximum security
column14: the rendezvous point is to be transmitted in code to the ships the day before. An ammunition ship is sent first to test the new system. Unbeknownst to the Americans
column15: a German spy ring in the city has already cracked their code and deliberately allowed the ship through in order to lure more valuable troop transports into their trap. However
column16: when Gordon manages to decipher one of their messages
column17: he realizes the truth and alerts his superiors. Brennan suspects his supposedly unbreakable code was stolen by his mistress
column18: Olivia Karloff
column19: and sets a trap. He catches her red-handed
column20: but foolishly he is alone
column21: and she shoots him dead. To her dismay
column22: she is ordered to sacrifice herself to divert suspicion from the spy ring. When she attends Brennan's funeral
column23: Gordon has her brought in for questioning. Carter sees her enter Gordon's office and becomes very jealous. Gordon lets Karloff go free so that she might lead him to the rest of the spies. The Germans decide to betray one of their own men
column24: Captain Nicholas Nieterstein
column25: in order to reassure the Americans and get them to resume operations. When he is arrested at the Russian Embassy
column26: Nieterstein apologizes to Ambassador Gregory  for giving his loyalty to his mother's country before flinging himself through a window to his death. Afterward
column27: Gordon escorts a shaken Karloff back to her hotel
column28: where he discovers her guilt. However
column29: since the hotel is staffed by German agents
column30: he is the one who is captured. He refuses to divulge the new American code until they show him that Carter is also a prisoner; she had followed the pair to the hotel. He then gives in and provides the coordinates of the new rendezvous point. When the Germans transmit the information
column31: it is decoded by the Americans. The latitude and longitude that Gordon had given are actually the address of the hotel. Gordon and Carter  are rescued. They get married."

The film has gained world wide attention in film festivals and has retained a small cult audience."

column1: 21500407;You;"{{Plot}} Husband and wife Rawdon  and Miranda  are soulmates. Their love for each other is palpable as they lie in bed treasuring their 6 month old daughter Quincey. Miranda fantasizes about the speech she plans to make when
column2: one day in their future
column3: she will give this tiny infant away at her wedding. Tragically
column4: when Quincey is 3
column5: Miranda is killed in a car accident and Rawdon is left alone
column6: unmoored
column7: to continue life without the love of his life. Fortunately Rawdon still has Quincey. Staying as strong as he can he takes her to the roof of a skyscraper and explains that Mommy is now an angel. It is up here that for the first time they see a vision of Miranda as an angel. Rawdon continues to see visions of her. Initially these visions help him—at home she gives him advice about parenting; in Portugal she softens his hardness; when he hides in the closet to isolate himself she snaps some sense into him and insists that Rawdon keep her mother
column8: father and brother—Quincey's Grandparents  and Uncle Jack  – firmly in Quincey's life. Rawdon explains these visions to his therapist Paula  as she helps him with the long grieving process and over a period of years
column9: with Quincey growing before our eyes
column10: Rawdon tries to move on with his life. He tries to date other women. Disastrously. He falls instantly in love with Sam  who ends up becoming his good friend and a surrogate Aunt to Quincey. He dates other including Kimberly  who Quincey wisely suggests is far better suited to her Uncle Jack. And she is right. When Jack and Kimberly get married
column11: Rawdon is their best man. All the while Miranda's metaphysical presence is with him. He goes from needing her
column12: to blaming her
column13: being angry at her. But for a long
column14: long time he won't let her go away. Part of him wants her to stay alive in his imagination forever and gradually this presence that helped him initially eventually becomes an impediment to his moving on in life. In contrast to her Dad's stagnation
column15: Quincey is growing up fast
column16: and in no time she is dating
column17: stealing cars
column18: trying to set her Dad up with her best friend's divorced Moms
column19: going off to University and falling in love with a Frenchman named Philippe. It is not until Rawdon finally plucks up the courage to ask out somebody who might just be right for him that he finally
column20: tearfully
column21: asks Miranda to leave him. This is ultimately a coming of age story. We watch Quincey literally come of age whilst her father
column22: emotionally
column23: comes of age. He eventually gives up the now stultifying memory of his dead wife and arrives at a new beginning. The end of this story is also the beginning of another where Rawdon
column24: surrounded by the people he loves—but without Miranda—finds himself giving Quincey away at her wedding to Philippe. And here he makes the speech that Miranda made in bed with him and Quincey so many years before."
