column1: 2322506;Fantastic Planet;"The film depicts a future in which human beings
column2: known as ""Oms""
column3: are creatures on the Draags' home planet
column4: where they are seen as pests and sometimes kept as pets . The Draags are an alien species which is humanoid in shape but a hundred times larger than humans
column5: with blue skin
column6: fan-like earlobes and huge
column7: protruding red eyes. The Draags also live much longer than human beings – one Draag week equals a human year. Some Oms are domesticated as pets
column8: but others run wild
column9: and are periodically exterminated. The Draags' treatment of the Oms is ironically contrasted with their high level of technological and spiritual development. The story opens with a woman running
column10: occasionally looking behind her as if pursued. An enormous hand descends and blocks her way. She runs back the way she came and finds her way blocked by another hand. It becomes apparent that she is being toyed with by entities that do not appreciate her fragility
column11: and as she dies
column12: the infant she has been carrying and attempting to protect begins to cry. The view changes to reveal the Draag children who have accidentally killed the woman; they leave quickly when an adult Draag and child approach. The child voices concern for the orphaned infant
column13: and the two take the child to their home. Tiva  names the infant Terr . Her father
column14: whom the adult Terr voice-over explains is master Sinh
column15: the Draag great Aedile
column16: attaches a collar capable of physically dragging Terr back from mischief
column17: and over the next several scenes
column18: their relationships develop. Terr witnesses the parents seemingly ingesting food by inhaling it from a device. After changing Terr's costume as one would a doll's
column19: Tiva uses makeup to give herself a more Om-like appearance. When Terr impishly trades dark pigment for light
column20: Tiva blows some of the powder on him. Tiva uses a tiny indoor weather-maker to cause a small storm cloud to form over Terr and chase him around the dwelling. Tiva takes Terr for a walk
column21: and then teaches him how
column22: under certain circumstances
column23: crystals will form on stationary objects
column24: including standing bipeds. She also teaches him that whistling will shatter the crystals. Terr happens upon master Sinh as he and several compatriots are melding in a ritual
column25: and it is revealed that many Draag children have Oms like Terr when they convene to watch their respective Oms interact. Tiva's education is supplied by the use of a headset that transmits knowledge directly into the brain of the user. Because she enjoys having Terr in her hand when she is having her ""infos
column26: Terr begins to acquire their knowledge. Meanwhile
column27: at the seat of government
column28: Draag Councilors discuss whether the regular extermination of the wild Oms is sufficient to keep their numbers at an acceptable level. It is revealed that Oms were first found on a planet that retained some evidence of structured life
column29: but the images seem to reveal that Earth was in a post-apocalyptic state at the time. Terr decides to escape
column30: and to take the headset with him. He does not get very far before Tiva realizes he is missing
column31: and her mother tells her to use her bracelet to bring him back. Terr finds himself suddenly being dragged backward by the collar. Only the headset becoming entangled in plants allows a wild female Om to come to his rescue before he is choked by the collar or dragged all the way back. When Terr explains that the headset contains the knowledge of the Draags but he doesn't know where to go with it
column32: his unnamed rescuer takes him to her tribe
column33: who live in a tree in a walled park. When it is demonstrated that Terr can read Draag script
column34: the leader  is willing to accept Terr into the tribe
column35: but the Wizard is not
column36: and demands a trial by combat – to the death. Terr and the Wizard's champion have child-sized animals bound to their torsos in such a way as to prevent the combatants from using anything but the beaks of said animals to attack. Terr is injured
column37: but wins the trial. Over the next several scenes
column38: it is shown how the Oms have adapted to life on the Draags' planet. Snail-like animals weave clothes onto the Oms
column39: predators that would eat Oms are in turn hunted and efficiently stripped of useful materials
column40: and the gene pool is kept well-mixed. Oms even make the occasional foray into Draag areas in search of resources. Returning from one such expedition
column41: the group of adventurers is accosted by bandits who drop clawlike harpoons into the cargo and simply lift it up into their own tree. Mighty One tells Terr that they live on the other side of the park
column42: and cautions him that they are evil. When the now-literate Oms read the new sign on one of the walls
column43: they realize the park is about to be ""de-Omised."" Terr decides that he must take this information to the tribe of bandits
column44: and is quickly captured and taken before their leader
column45: a wizened old woman. The woman is skeptical of his claims and orders Terr's imprisonment. When the de-Omising begins
column46: however
column47: the old woman returns and frees him. The de-Omising is accomplished using disks that release a poison gas. A great many Oms perish from this gas
column48: but a sizable number still manage to escape through a crack in the park wall. Two passing Draags witness the exodus
column49: and one begins crushing the Oms underfoot. The Oms retaliate and manage to kill their attacker while the other escapes. Afterward
column50: Mighty one is revealed to be killed and the old woman leads the survivors to a place where she believes they will be safe. The death of a Draag puts the Council in an uproar. De-Omising is stepped up to a much higher priority
column51: new technologies are developed
column52: and extermination frequency is scheduled to greatly increase. The old woman has led the two now-united tribes to an old rocket depot. Applying their newfound knowledge
column53: the Oms
column54: under Terr's direction
column55: very quickly adapt the abandoned technologies to their own purposes and begin to flourish
column56: thanks to the rebirth of mechanized industry. On a visit to the old woman
column57: Terr's wife hears her express both optimism and regret that she will not live to see the Oms finally find peace. Fatalities resulting from Draag attempts to de-Om the rocket depot are minimized by the creation and organized use of shelters
column58: but the Draags' updated de-Omising technologies become ever more aggressive
column59: and when an automated scout detects the persistent Om settlement
column60: it summons an array of lethal devices. As the attacks become more diverse and effective
column61: the Oms launch their manned rockets toward the Fantastic Planet
column62: where they discover headless humanoid statues. As Draag meditation bubbles descend to alight atop the statues
column63: the statues begin to dance. It is revealed via Terr's voiceover that this is the secret of the Fantastic Planet. Draag meditation animates the statues and allows the Draag to reproduce. When the feet of the dancing statues threaten the rockets
column64: the Oms use energy weapons to shatter the statues
column65: effectively killing thousands of meditative Draag. Pandemonium reigns in the Council chamber
column66: for it seems the two species will destroy one another if they cannot find a way to live together. Apparently they do just that
column67: for in the very next scene
column68: an Om steps down off an outstretched Draag hand
column69: removes his silly hat and assumes a posture of confidence and self-assertion. The headset voice dispassionately recounts the Om's construction of a new satellite where Oms can live

column1: 1813912;Tell Them Willie Boy Is Here;"The film's story revolves around the Paiute Indian outlaw Willie Boy ([[Robert Blake  who escapes with his lover
column2: Lola  after killing her father in self defense. According to tribal custom Willie can then claim Lola as his wife. According to the law
column3: Deputy Sheriff Cooper  is required to charge him with murder. Willie Boy and Lola are hunted for several days by a posse led by Cooper. Willie manages to repel the posse’s advance when he ambushes them from the top of Ruby Mountain. He only tries to shoot their horses

It is left deliberately ambiguous whether Lola shot herself in order to slow down the posse's advance or whether Willie killed her to keep her out of the posse's hands. Cooper is inclined to believe the latter and then goes off ahead of the posse to bring in Willie dead or alive. As soon as Cooper catches up
column8: he comes under fire from Willie who is positioned at the top of Ruby Mountain. Cooper narrowly avoids being shot on several occasions. In the film's climax
column9: Cooper maneuvers behind Willie
column10: who has donned a ghost shirt
column11: and tells him he can turn around if he wants to
column12: which he does. The two pause before Willie raises his rifle at Cooper
column13: who beats him to the draw and shoots him. Fatally struck in the chest
column14: Willie tumbles down the hillside. Cooper picks up Willie’s gun and finds that it wasn't even loaded
column15: making it apparent that Willie deliberately chose death over capture. Abashed
column16: Cooper carries the slain outlaw the rest of the way down Ruby Mountain and delivers him to other Paiutes
column17: who carry the corpse away and burn the remains. When confronted by the county sheriff
column18: Cooper is told that the burning of Willie's body will ruin the people's chance to see Willie in the  flesh
column19: denying them the ability ""to see something"". Cooper retorts: ""Tell them we're all out of souvenirs."""

column1: 9138693;The Truth about Nanjing;"The Truth about Nanjing was planned to be a three-part film. * The first section was ""Seven condemned criminals""  This part shows the last day of the seven people who were condemned to death in 1948 by the International Military Tribunal for the Far East and executed on 23 December 1948 at Sugamo Prison
column2: Tokyo. * The second section was for verification.  * The third section was for America."

column1: 19332675;Othello;"The film is narrated by Ben Jago
column2: a corrupt police detective who is prepared to manipulate those around him to get what he wants
column3: even the people he loves. After the Commissioner of London's Metropolitan Police Sinclair Carver is caught using racist language he is forced to resign. The Home Secretary and Prime Minister choose John Othello
column4: a black policeman and Jago's best friend
column5: to be the next Commissioner as a publicity stunt after a reporter praises him for ending a riot. Jago
column6: Carver's second-in-command
column7: feels that Othello stole his chance to become Commissioner himself
column8: as he had been the favourite for the job. Jago plots to take revenge on Othello by ruining his life and driving him out of his new job. Jago posts on a neo-Nazi website about Othello's marriage to Dessie Brabant
column9: a wealthy white woman
column10: leading her to be attacked in the street. When Othello asks Jago to lend him a man to look after her during the day Jago suggests Michael Cass
column11: an attractive inspector and known womanizer
column12: to look after Dessie. Jago also seduces Dessie's best friend
column13: Lulu
column14: to try to get information about Dessie's past and her relationship with Cass. During this Othello has Jago look into the death of Billy Coates
column15: a black drug addict
column16: who was battered to death by three policemen claiming it was self-defense. He discovers
column17: via PC Alan Roderick
column18: that the three policemen actually went to Coastes' flat with the intention of attacking him. Jago sympathises with Roderick and offers protection in return for him testifying against the other three policemen. Upon discovering this Othello is given all the credit. Furious that he has once again been overlooked by Othello
column19: Jago decides to ruin the case. Roderick is called to give evidence at the trial causing the other policemen to rebuff him. The day he is called to trial he is found dead from an overdose
column20: and it is suggested that Jago overdosed Roderick with alcohol
column21: knowing he was on anti-depressants. Jago offers to take the blame
column22: but Othello refuses
column23: telling him that he is the ""only person [he] can trust."" Through Jago's prompting and several misunderstandings between Dessie and Cass
column24: Othello begins to become paranoid that Dessie is having an affair. Jago suggests they use DNA to test whether Dessie and Cass sleeping together. During a televised interview Othello has a breakdown and even attacks Cass in a car park. Jago starts to feel guilty
column25: but decides that it is out of his hands. Nonetheless he tells Othello that he got the DNA tests back
column26: confirming that Dessie is having an affair. That night Othello returns home to confront her. When Dessie denies it Othello kills her in a fit of anger. Worried when they don't get a response at the door
column27: Jago and Lulu break into the flat to find Dessie dead. Jago tells Othello that the tests were negative and Dessie was innocent. Realising that he had been manipulated
column28: Othello asks Jago why he did it
column29: to which Jago states that Othello took what was his; despite everything
column30: however
column31: Jago states that he still loves Othello and always will. Jago and Lulu wait outside for the police to arrive when Othello commits suicide. Shortly after the Home Secretary and Prime Minister decide to choose a more reliable pair of hands for the Commissioner
column32: choosing Jago. The film ends with Jago stating that it wasn't about race or politics but love
column33: ""simple as that."""

column1: 26499399;Agent Vinod;{{Plot}} In the Dasht-E-Margoh desert in remote Afghanistan
column2: inside a Taliban camp
column3: an ISI official
column4: Col. Huzefa
column5: is interrogating a captured man  suspected to be a Research and Analysis Wing  agent. The man offers up details about RAW's operations in Afghanistan in exchange for money and safe passage across the border. He betrays his colleague

column7: who has also infiltrated the camp. This is only a ruse

column24: Vinod gets closer to Ruby
column25: and tries to find out what '242' is. Ruby is actually Iram
column26: a British-Pakistani who is working undercover for the ISI. Vinod goes to meet the MI6 agent and finds him murdered in his room with strong pointers that the murder was committed by Ruby. He gets an invitation card from the murdered agent's room for a private auction. He learns that many international terrorist groups are converging at an antiques auction in Marakkesh to purchase '242'. Vinod brings Ruby to the auction
column27: where Kazan is also present along with Jagadishwar Metla . Vinod spots an LTTE agent he had encountered previously

column32: Baluchistan
column33: the head of the ISI is murdered by Col. Huzefa
column34: who is actually part of a group of rogue ISI colonels planning an attack on India. In Morocco
column35: Kazan locks the detonator with a password
column36: and hands it over to Colonel
column37: who has arrived in Morocco. Iram runs into the real Freddie Khambatta

'Colonel' captures Ruby and asks her to reveal the whereabouts of Agent Vinod. He plants a sniper next to the hotel where Agent Vinod is to rendezvous with Ruby. The sniper takes a shot at him but Vinod manages to escape and is admitted to a hospital. The assassin reaches the hospital in the guise of a doctor and tries to administer a venom injection to Vinod. Vinod spots the scorpion tattoo on the doctor's forearm and overpowers him

Iram tells Vinod that the Colonel has called for a meeting at Karachi with fugitive don Pasha who can also be in the plot. The Colonel gets the Rubaiyat and tells his men to kill Vinod and Iram. column1: 26393786;3 saisons;The film tells three stories. The first two are about two couples whose lives are extreme opposites but they share one thing in common: an unexpected pregnancy. Carmine and Sasha live in a carefree world and the arrival of a child blows their middle-class life to the ground: behind the illusion of their fancy condominium and their successful careers hides a couple that is in pain and living with secrets and lies. Meanwhile
column2: Justine and Seb are freedom seekers that live day by day on the streets of Montreal. These two young squeegee kids are hoping for a better future
column3: but in the meantime seem to be content with small-time jobs. Justine's pregnancy catches Seb off guard as he has better things to do than to be a father. Their violent relationship makes getting an abortion the obvious choice. Yet things just get worse. In the third story
column4: Stephen Decker is a 50-something father who has lost everything
column5: his wife
column6: his only child
column7: and his inner peace. Now he has found a new purpose for his life: revenge
column8: which brings him from Calgary to Montreal as he attempts to hunt down his daughter's murderer. What he finds is far from what he expected
column9: and five destinies converge
column10: for better and for worse.

column1: 27997130;Demobbed;Three young Russians from very different walks of life involutarily enter the military to escape their past.
7429667;Saved by the Bell: Wedding in Las Vegas;"{{plot}} The movie begins with a Three Stooges style gag involving paintball
column2: Slater
column3: Zack
column4: and Screech. The movie's mood is interrupted when Zack returns home and discovers that his father disapproves of Zack's upcoming wedding to Kelly
column5: and thus will not fund the ceremony. Zack tells his mother Melanie that because his father won't support him
column6: he will pull off some kind of wedding with the $1
column7: 200 he has. Melanie gives Zack two free passes to stay at the Stardust Hotel in Las Vegas for the time he will be there. The next day
column8: Kelly
column9: Slater
column10: Screech and Lisa arrive at Zack's house and begin packing their cars for the trip to Las Vegas. With the girls in one vehicle and the guys in the other

column13: where they first met as a group. As they race down a back road

column16: on another back road

He fixes the fan belt by using Lisa's expensive belt and replenishes the radiator with the girls drinking water. In return
column19: he asks to be driven to Las Vegas. The girls get to Las Vegas first

column21: the boys get booked
column22: photographed and thrown into a jail cell with a yuppy murderer
column23: named Herb
column24: and a biker/poet

column30: and Slater eyes a pretty girl in the lobby. Lisa and Kelly see the rest of the guys and they are reunited. But Zack doesn't tell Kelly about losing nearly all of his money he plans to pay for the wedding. The next morning
column31: in an attempt to earn back their money

column33: whose name is Carla
column34: and she works as a cashier at the pro shop. After Screech accidentally drives the golf carts into a pond
column35: the guys get fired and earn no money. Later that afternoon at the Stardust
column36: the guys and girls play around in the hotel pool. Here
column37: Slater again runs into Carla who agrees to go out with him. But two mysterious thugs oversee this. Meanwhile at the hotel's restaurant

column39: but realizing that they can earn $200 a day

column45: Zack is forced to dine with Kelly at the Top of the Strip Restaurant at the Union Plaza Hotel while he dines at the same time with his escort: a Russian woman named Katrina. But Kelly soon figures out what's going on. After Kelly follows Zack to Katrina's table

column48: but she and Lisa won't let him in. Zack goes into his room next door and climbs out onto the balcony to climb over the railing to get to Kelly's balcony to talk to her. Back at the restaurant
column49: Slater's date is interrupted when Carla's ex-boyfriend Freddy Silver
column50: a mobster
column51: arrives and yells at her for going behind his back in seeing someone else. When Slater knocks Freddy down
column52: he and Carla are forced to run when the two thugs appear
column53: who turn out to be Freddy's bodyguards. Slater and Carla run back to their room at the Stardust. But when they go out onto the balcony
column54: they surprise Zack who slips and almost falls. In the girls room
column55: Zack explains everything to Kelly and she forgives him. Next
column56: Carla tells the gang that Freddy wants her and all of them dead because she knows that he's in town to steal the Considine Diamond. Lisa gets Kurt to help smuggle Slater and Carla out of the hotel by putting them in a luggage rack. But when they get to the hotel's main entrance
column60: exposing Slater and Carla. So Zack grabs Screech and the four of them get into Slater's Bronco. Freddy's thugs commandeer a taxi and take off after them
column62: Lisa and Kurt in Lisa's BMW. A car chase ensues. Zack
column64: Screech and Carla abandon their Bronco in a traffic jam at the end of Fremont Street and escape by hiding out in a wax museum by impersonating waxwork figures. But on the street
column65: the four are spotted again by Freddy's thugs who chase them into a casino. The guys and Carla sneak into a Las Vegas dance show dressed as showgirls. But backstage
column66: they're all captured by the thugs as well as Lisa
column67: Kelly and Kurt who stumble by. The gang is taken to Freddy's room where they fail to talk their way to freedom. But Kurt suddenly announces that he is the son of the Stardust Hotel owner and he tells Freddy that he can get him to the diamond. Freddy still refuses to let any of them go and he forces Kurt to take them to the vault where the diamond is. Kurt opens the vault
column68: and when Freddy and one of his thugs go in
column70: Slater and Screech once again pull off their ""Three Stooges"" routine and trick the thug guarding them. They push him into the vault and the gang locks Freddy and his two thugs in it. After everything is resolved
column71: the gang immediately goes to the nearest wedding chapel for Kelly and Zack to get married. The Silver Bells Chapel is run by Bert Banner! Just as he is about to marry them
column72: Derek and Melanie Morris burst in. They tell them that Slater had earlier called them and convinced them to respect Zack and Kelly for what they are doing
column73: so they have a change of heart: they now support Zack and Kelly's marriage. A few days later

column75: with Lisa being the Maid of Honor and Screech being Zack's best man. The wedding march begins and Kelly is escorted down the aisle by her father
column76: Frank Kapowski. As the ceremony begins
column77: Jessie Spano suddenly bursts in saying that she couldn't miss the wedding for the world
column78: making the gang of Bayside complete. A montage shows Zack and Kelly's up's and downs from ""Saved By the Bell"" from 9th grade to the college years. Zack and Kelly recite their vows
column79: the minister pronounces them man and wife. After the ceremony
column80: Zack and Kelly are congratulated one by one by the gang as well as Mike Rogers
column81: Alex Tabor and even Richard Belding. Kelly gets a tearful congrats from Jessie. Slater gives a toast to all assembled who include Kurt and Carla. Kelly's parents Frank and Carol
column82: congratulate her and Melanie and Derek congratulate Zack. That evening
column83: Lisa and Kurt  say goodbye to Zack and Kelly who are packing their stuff into a limo to take them on their honeymoon. Screech gives them a tearful goodbye as do Slater and Carla . Slater says: ""It's the end of an era."" Kelly throws the bouquet to Screech who catches it. Then Diana suddenly appears and chases Screech away. Zack and Kelly then take off in the limo as the screen fades to the credits."

column1: 30866673;Billa 2;David Billa
column2: a Sri Lankan refugee arrives at the city of Rameswaram in a boat. He is interrogated by a corrupt police officer before he is allowed to enter the refuge camp . At the shelter he befriends Ranjith  and others. After a series of events the corrupt police officer Raghubir Sinha ([[Krishna Kumar  conspires against them
column3: but is eventually killed by Billa. Soon
column4: Billa and Ranjith are made to transport fish from Rameshwaram to Chennai. But the fishes had diamonds hidden them and as per the plot they get caught in the check post . Soon after realizing what had happened he kills all the cops and delivers the fish on time to Selvaraj  who recruits them for his illegal activities . He then goes back to meet his elder sister  and her daughter Jasmine  in a church. When they see his gun
column5: they realize that he is involved in crime
column6: and he is forced to leave the church. Kotiswara Rao  comes to meet Selvaraj and expresses his grievances that he was unable to sell cocaine in Goa. Billa promises to sell it and sets out to meet a local thug who betrays them and one of Billa's friend gets killed in the process. Billa evades the scene with both the money and the cocaine. He goes to meet Abbasi  in Goa who is the boss of Kotiswara Rao. He likes Billa and recruits him. He also introduces his girlfriend Sameera  to him. After a party held at his club he receives a phone call from the Russian mafia led by Dimitri  telling him that his arms consignment has been held by the Indian coastal guards and he asks for his help. Billa and Ranjith retrieve the consignment for him. Both are congratulated by Dimitri for their work. After Billa's sister dies
column7: he brings back Jasmine with him to live in a big villa. Then he goes to Russia to meet Dimitri who happens to own an arms and ammunition manufacturing unit
column8: with Kotiswara Rao where he signs a deal with Dimitri without the knowledge of Abbasi in presence of Jagdish ([[Rahman . Abbasi became furious and Kotiswara Rao adds fuel to the fire. Abbasi turns against Billa
column9: and eventually gets killed by him in the series of events. Now Billa becomes the most powerful crime lord extending his business without any boundaries . Dimitri meets David Billa and asks him to provide a safe passage for the arms consignment through India. Billa denies it as his payment intended was very low . Angered by the wrath of David Billa he hires Kotiswara Rao
column10: along with a government minister and his son to eliminate Billa . They conspire a plot to eliminate Billa and they kidnap Jasmine. Billa rescues her and he informs Sameera to come to the church to take Jasmine away to Malaysia to safety . But Sameera conspires against them and the goons with the minister's son arrive and held both Billa and Sameera captives. Billa is stabbed by one of the goons . After a verbal argument between them
column11: the minister's son slits Jasmine's throat. Unable to witness the death of his love
column12: Billa kills all the goons including the minister's son . Meanwhile in Russia
column13: Dimitri is having an auction for sale and kotiswara Rao is also present with him . He shows his factory in his computer via a series of webcams and Billa is seen destroying his factory . He also sees his delivery train go off course . Angered with fear he kills Kotiswara Rao for not killing Billa as promised and he sets out himself to finish the task . The delivery train is blown by Billa and he encounters Dimitri on his helicopter. After an intense battle
column14: Billa kills Dimitri by throwing him out of the helicopter. In the concluding scene
column15: Billa and Ranjith board a plane to Malaysia
column16: and the former's goons eliminate the rest of the conspirators including Sameera.

column1: 34501845;Luv Shuv Tey Chicken Khurana;Omi Khurana’s London dream has just ended. On the run from a dangerous UK gangster who he owes money to
column2: Omi returns to his native village in Punjab
column3: pretending to be a well-heeled London lawyer. Much has changed since Omi ran away from home a decade back after stealing money from his doting grandfather
column4: Darji. The old man has since become senile and most importantly
column5: forgotten the secret recipe of “Chicken Khurana” a dish that made the Khurana dhaba  famous across Punjab. Omi’s childhood sweetheart
column6: Harman is soon to be married to his cousin
column7: Jeet
column8: though neither seems too happy about it. Adding to the quirkiness of the Khurana family is a free loader uncle
column9: Titu
column10: who once did a stint at a mental asylum. Will Omi be able to cover his deceit and lies for long
column11: even as he tries to recover the lost recipe of “Chicken Khurana” – the family’s only hope to reclaim their pride & wealth. Luv Shuv Tey Chicken Khurana{{cite web}} – a delectable comedy served up this 2nd November by the team that gave you Khosla Ka Ghosla & Dev D.

column1: 30622939;Dark and Stormy Night;"On a dark and stormy night in the 1930s
column2: a number of people gather at an isolated country estate to hear the reading of the will of the wealthy Sinas Cavinder
column3: including: wealthy nephew Burling Famish Jr.  and his wife Pristy ; Pristy's dim-witted lover Teak Armbruster ; big-game hunter Jack Tugdon ; the foppish Lord Partfine ; elderly Mrs. Hausenstout ; kindly Seyton Ethelquake ; and the fragile Sabasha Fanmoore
column4: Cavinder's ward. They are joined by rival reporters Eight O'Clock Faraday  and Billy Tuesday  along with cab driver Happy Codburn
column5: to whom Faraday owes ""toity-five cents"" . The party grows by two when psychic Mrs. Cupcupboard  and ""stranded motorist"" Ray Vestinhaus  arrive unexpectedly. The large group gathers in the home's parlor so that lawyer Farper Twyly  can read the will. Before Twyly begins
column6: the guests note the unusual threats surrounding the estate: Sabasha has been the subject of mysterious death threats; a serial killer known as the ""Cavinder Strangler"" is still at large and in the area; and it happens to be the same night on which the 300-year-old ghost of Sarah Cavinder is supposed to return. Twyly reads the will
column7: revealing that some characters receive trivial gifts and other substantial ones. The bulk of the estate is given to Sabasha
column8: but with the clause that upon her death the estate would then be given to Burling. Twyly then reveals the existence of an additional letter that amends the will; he discovers that it has been stolen
column9: but assures the group that he and only he knows the contents. Before he can recite the letter
column10: the lights are turned off. When they are turned back on
column11: the group discovers that Twyly has been stabbed to death. When Ray tells the group that the only bridge back to town collapsed behind him
column12: Faraday and Tuesday suggest that they all wait until morning for the police to arrive. However
column13: at the stroke of midnight
column14: Pristy is strangled by a masked killer. Dr. Van Von Vandervon  arrives and announces that he's tracked an escaped lunatic to the house
column15: but because of the nature of his work
column16: he is not sure what the patient looks like
column17: or even if it's a man or woman. Over the course of the evening
column18: the group attempts to find both the letter and clues leading to the killer. A seance is held by Mrs. Cupcupboard
column19: but the spirit  is of no help. Mrs. Hausenstout occasionally pops up with a gorilla  in tow
column20: and a police inspector  arrives--and is promptly killed. As the night progresses
column21: Jack
column22: Teak
column23: Seyton and Dr. Von Vandervon are murdered
column24: as is Archie the cook . Happy discovers a woman  locked in an attic room. Although the group assumes she is the ghost of Sarah Cavinder
column25: the housemaid Jane  tells them that she is Thessaly
column26: the confrontational and slightly insane daughter of Sinas Cavinder. Jane also knows the contents of the letter and tells Faraday and Tuesday that the letter makes Thessaly
column27: not Sabasha
column28: the inheritor of the estate. Faraday and Tuesday track down and confront the guilty parties--Burling and Sabasha
column29: who began the night working independently but who later ""joined forces"" to knock off their rivals to the inheritance. Faraday and Tuesday also deduce that the real Sabasha is dead and that the woman pretending to be her is actually Dr. Von Vandervon's escaped lunatic. Burling threatens to blow up the house unless Faraday and Tuesday turn over the letter
column30: but he is accidentally electrocuted after being confronted by Thessaly. Ray appears and admits that he is actually Bax Tremblay
column31: a police investigator working undercover. He
column32: Faraday
column33: and Tuesday attempt to apprehend the false Sabasha
column34: but she strangles herself to death to avoid capture. The next morning
column35: Thessaly takes possession of the estate. Faraday proposes marriage to Tuesday and she accepts; the two of them agree to share their newspaper ""scoop."" They are driven away by Happy
column36: who belatedly realizes that because he left the cab's meter running all night
column37: Faraday owes him $87.42."

column1: 1373219;Darkness;"Forty years after an unfinished occult ritual resulted in the disappearance of six children
column2: an American family has moved into a never-before inhabited house in Spain. The mother
column3: Maria
column4: wants to get the place in order
column5: while the father
column6: Mark
column7: goes to work
column8: and their children
column9: teenager Regina  and her younger brother Paul
column10: try to settle into their daily routines. It helps that Mark's doctor-father
column11: Albert Rua  has furnished them with their residence and is nearby
column12: especially when Mark begins to suffer from some mental breakdown attacks that periodically reoccur. Regina is not only worried about him
column13: but also Paul who is now scared of the dark for the first time. The young boy has reason for that
column14: however
column15: as there seems to be some sort of supernatural force beneath his bed. Furthermore
column16: there are instances when figures of children are seen standing in the shadow and darkness
column17: watching the family. As Paul becomes more scared and their father increasingly unstable
column18: Regina eventually figures out it must have something to do with their home where the power is lost everyday. With the help of her new friend
column19: Carlos
column20: the two eventually meet the man
column21: Villalobos
column22: who designed the house
column23: and learn that it was built for a supernatural ritual requiring the sacrifice of seven children  to coincide with an eclipse that only occurs every forty years. With the next one quickly approaching
column24: and now armed with the knowledge that the earlier occult ritual needs one more death to be completed
column25: Regina races to make sure that Paul is not the final victim.  Taking a shortcut through her grandfather Albert's house
column26: Regina finds out that her grandfather is
column27: in fact
column28: a member of the cult which has been performing these satanic rituals. Her grandfather explains that in the ritual forty years ago
column29: there actually were seven children in the original ritual
column30: the seventh child being none other than Regina's father
column31: Mark. Albert did not sacrifice his son because at the last minute he realized that he did not love Mark. Waiting 40 years he has brought Mark and his family to the house with the intention of making sure Mark is sacrificed during this eclipse by ""hands that love him."" Armed with this knowledge
column32: Regina races back to her home to find her father in the midst of another nervous breakdown
column33: choking on pills as the eclipse begins. Maria tries to perform a tracheotomy on him
column34: but is unable to bring herself to make the cut. Regina volunteers to
column35: but inadvertently causes his death. Since Regina genuinely loved Mark
column36: the ritual is finally complete. The darkness then takes the form of Regina and Paul
column37: convincing their mother to turn off the lights. The darkness kills Maria
column38: and then takes the form of Regina's friend Carlos
column39: who picks them up in his car. The real Carlos arrives at the house
column40: only to be killed by the darkness. The movie ends with the fake Carlos drives Regina and Paul into a dark tunnel
column41: where it is implied that the darkness kills Regina and Paul."

column1: 2311219;Munich;"{{Plot}}  The film begins with a depiction of the events of the 1972 Munich Olympics. After the killings
column2: the Israeli government devises an eye for an eye retaliation; and a target list of 11 names is drawn up. Avner Kaufman
column3: an Israeli-born Mossad agent of German-Jewish descent
column4: is chosen to lead the assassination squad and is given the assignment over tea at the home of Prime Minister of Israel Golda Meir. To give the Israeli government plausible deniability and
column5: at the direction of his handler Ephraim
column6: Avner resigns from Mossad; and the squad operates with no official ties to Israel. Avner is given a team of four Jewish men: Steve
column7: a South African driver; Hans
column8: a document forger; Robert
column9: a Belgian toy-maker trained in defusing explosives; and Carl
column10: a former Israeli soldier who ""cleans up"" after the assassinations. Avner and his team set about tracking down the 11 targets with the help of a shadowy French informant
column11: Louis . In Rome
column12: the group tracks down their first target
column13: Abdel Wael Zwaiter
column14: who is broke and living as a poet. The group follows him to his apartment building
column15: and Avner and Robert shoot him dead. In Paris
column16: Robert pretends to be a journalist interviewing their second target
column17: Mahmoud Hamshari
column18: about the Munich massacre. He plants a bomb in Hamshari's phone that is set to be detonated by a remote key. Carl is to dial Hamshari's number from a public telephone booth after Hamshari's wife and daughter have left. However
column19: while a large truck obscures their view
column20: the daughter runs back inside to retrieve something. Carl calls the number
column21: and the girl picks up; but Avner aborts the mission before Robert
column22: who cannot see what is going on
column23: triggers the explosion. When the girl leaves
column24: Carl telephones the number
column25: asks the man who answers if he's Hamshari; and
column26: upon affirmation of name
column27: Robert detonates the bomb. In Cyprus
column28: the team kills the next target
column29: Hussein Al Bashir
column30: by planting a bomb in his hotel room beneath his bed. Avner gets a room next to Al Bashir and turns off his bedroom light
column31: the signal to proceed. When Robert detonates the bomb
column32: the explosives almost kill Avner and injures a newlywed couple next door. The group meet later aboard a boat in the Cyprus harbour to discuss the errors in the mission. Robert insists that the explosives he used were far more powerful than what he expected. It is revealed at this juncture that Louis provided the explosives and that he is also helping with the logistics of the hits through Avner. Avner then meets with Louis in Paris and he gives the team information on three Palestinians in Beirut: Muhammad Youssef al-Najjar ; Kamal Adwan; and Kamal Nasser
column33: a Palestine Liberation Organization  spokesman. Ephraim refuses to let them handle the mission themselves. Avner insists that he will lose Louis' trust if the operation is carried out by the Israel Defense Forces . Ephraim relents
column34: allowing the team to accompany the IDF commandos. In Beirut
column35: Steve
column36: Robert
column37: and Avner meet up with a group of Sayeret Matkal IDF soldiers. They penetrate the Palestinians' guarded compound and kill all three. In Athens
column38: Louis has provided the team with an apartment. During the night
column39: four PLO members
column40: who have rented the same apartment as a safe house
column41: enter the dwelling. After a tense confrontation with guns drawn
column42: Robert defuses the situation by claiming that his squad are members of the Basque separatist Euskadi Ta Askatasuna
column43: Red Army Faction
column44: and the African National Congress . Avner discusses Middle East politics with the group's leader. Avner's group carries out their next assassination
column45: that of Zaiad Muchasi
column46: by installing a remote-controlled bomb in Muchasi's TV set. However
column47: the bomb does not detonate. Hans walks into the hotel
column48: forces his way and throws a grenade that sets off the bomb
column49: killing Muchasi. The squad exchanges gunfire with Muchasi's bodyguards. In the chaos
column50: they are forced to take the hotel manager hostage; and Robert reveals that he doesn't actually build bombs
column51: but just defuses them. Louis provides the squad with information on Ali Hassan Salameh
column52: the organizer of the Munich Massacre. Avner learns from Louis that the CIA have a deal with Salameh wherein they protect and fund him in exchange for his promise not to attack US diplomats. The squad moves to London to track down Salameh
column53: but they are not able to accomplish the assassination when Avner is suddenly approached by several drunken Americans. It is implied the said Americans are actually CIA agents. Avner is propositioned by a woman  in the hotel but declines. Afterward
column54: Carl is killed by the same woman
column55: who Avner learns is an independent Dutch contract killer. Robert questions the morality of the entire mission; Avner listens to him and asks him to take a break. The remaining squad tracks the Dutch assassin to the Netherlands and kills her without a glitch. Afterwards Avner
column56: Steve and Hans discuss the futility of the mission. Later
column57: Hans is found stabbed to death and left on a park bench while Robert is killed in an explosion in his workshop. Avner and Steve finally locate Salameh in Spain; however
column58: their assassination attempt is thwarted by Salameh's guards. A disillusioned Avner flies to Israel and then to his new home in New York City to reunite with his wife and their child. In a fit of paranoia
column59: he storms into the Israeli consulate and screams at an employee whom he believes to be a Mossad agent to leave him and his family alone. Ephraim comes to New York to urge Avner to rejoin Mossad. In the final scene
column60: Avner openly questions the basis and effectiveness of the operation
column61: and Ephraim admits that there was no evidence linking any of the targets to the Munich massacre. In a show of respect
column62: Avner asks Ephraim to break bread with him
column63: but because he has refused to return to Israel
column64: Ephraim rejects him and leaves. Avner leaves as well. During the last scene
column65: the camera pans across the New York City skyline and stops with the Twin Towers in the center of the scene. A postscript notes that 9 of the 11 men targeted by Mossad were eventually assassinated

column1: 26834911;Face the Evil;Erich Dengler
column2: the son of Manferd Dengler
column3: poses as an Art Collector
column4: Eric Dane
column5: in order to take over the Holman Museum where he holds the occupants including Sharon Bell and Jack Terry who are shooting a film. Dengler attempts to unleash a lethal nerve gas bomb which threatens the safety of the world. His plan is to sell the rest of the nerve gas to the highest bidder. Jack and Sharon make it their business to stop him.

column1: 20120996;Friendship;{{Plot}} Singha  receives a call from Jazz
column2: a high school friend. Jazz sets up a high school reunion from their class only. The entire bunch meets up
column3: they had a conversation and turns into Singha's last year of high school memory. Where he met his first and only love
column4: Mituna . At first day of their final year in high school
column5: Singha was waiting for a bus and had seen a woman fell down. He helped the woman and gave her a marigold flower
column6: then rode a bus to go to school. They had two new classmates
column7: Lam and Mituna. Mituna got late from class at that time but was excused because she was new from the school. She sat beside Jazz and in front of her is Kanda whom she became friends with. At first
column8: Singha and his pals mocked Mituna for being so silent. He got friends with Lam who had helped him survive under Kong who tried to kill him. Lam became close with Singha's group. Mituna hated Singha more when Singha made fun of her because they were dance partners. Until
column9: Mituna fought back in the bus because they made fun of her because she had helped a mute woman. From that time on
column10: Singha had been stalking Mituna because he wanna know where she lived. He asked forgiveness to her but Mituna does not want to talk to him. Singha's group together with Jazz and Kanda asked Mituna's mom to have Mituna be with them in their project. They went upcountry and helped educate kids by giving them handouts and others. In a bonfire that night
column11: Singha opened up his feelings by telling his most and second most favorite flower whom he referred as Mituna. He wanted to give the bright side of Mituna. Mituna's pal and Singha's group became close to each other and helped fix Mituna's house. The group goes out together in resort and the skate club. Until
column12: Singha and Mituna had fallen in love with each other. Lam got killed by Kong that brings sorrow to the group. Singha gave Mituna a paper to sign for their friendship book. She went home and had known that they had to move upcountry. In the final exam day
column13: Mituna lied to Singha by telling him that she had to go upcountry for few days. After taking the last exam
column14: she leave a note to Singha that they would talk at the result day. Prior to the result day
